story:
Today Ploppy is sad.

You can ask us why. Just look at the sum of contributions he's got. That's why. It means that he won't get new animations. Moreover he won't get any animation! But you could change everything! Read the text below and figure out how!

Short Summary

Hi there! The last couple of years we are passionately developing a physics based game, the main feature of which is the interaction of air bubbles with different creatures and objects in the game, like snails, cliffs and of course our main hero - Ploppy!


At this point in time we feel we are 80% finished. Complex physics have already been implemented that allows to model air bubble behaviour, different algorithms have also been created which allows us to dynamically create beautiful levels and cliffs and lots lots more. But we are faced with financial difficulties which could slow our development progress and could postpone the release of the game to an indefinite time. In order for that not to happen, here we are!

The following video shows the current state of the game:


Ploppy's story

The game takes place on planets that are located in a far far away galaxy. The surface of these planets is covered entirely with water. Our hero Ploppy lives on one of these planets. Ploppy is a friendly and a somewhat clumsy little creature. And ever since he was little he dreamt about traveling to other planets. When he was a child there was a story that changed his life and gave him 3 new friends. This was his birthday and his present was a ROCKET that he dreamed so long about. Ofcourse he ran straightaway outside and tried to launch it. He managed it on his first try. He controlled the rocket as if he were an ace and he had been controlling rockets all his life. While playing, Ploppy noticed an underwater butterfly. Like any teenager, he was a bit of a hooligan and he tried to scare the butterfly. A slight touch of the remote control and the rocket flew after the butterfly, shooting out bubbles from its engines, Ploppy in close pursuit. Suddenly Ploppy tripped and the remote control flew from his hands. The out of control rocket plummeted into a crevasse that was near Ploppy’s house and disappeared in the murky depths.

When he understood what happened Ploppy was very sad and he started to cry. His cries attracted the attention of three unusual inhabitants of this place - 3 bubbles appeared from a crevice below. They were no ordinary bubbles. They had eyes, they could attach themselves to objects using their special hands that looked like vortexes. Once they understood what had happened, the bubbles disappeared for a moment and soon brought the toy back to Ploppy. Ever since Ploppy and his 3 new friends were inseperable. 

They went to school together, then to college and became profound specialists in rocket building. When they grew up they decided to fulfill their dream of traveling to other planets and they built a rocket. 

The rocket was simply magnificent and the friends agreed to take it out immediately for a test run. They were in deep space whizzing by other planets when suddenly an asteroid hit their rocket causing a gaping gash in the fuel tank. Fuel, that resembles bundles of energy spheres, started leaking out at an alarming rate. They were forced to land immediately on one of the planets. Fixing the hole was not a problem, but where could they get the fuel to bring them back home? Ploppy noticed a small bubble with some fuel not far away. And here the game begins. Each level will have the main hero and his 3 friends. Using the bubbles the player will have to collect the fuel and deliver it to Ploppy. Each level box will contain 25 levels. After Ploppy and his friends collect all the fuel, they climb into the rocket and fly to another planet. The main goal of the game is to bring Ploppy home.

What We Need & What You Get

To finish the game we dont need that much

  • Animation of Ploppy and other game elements
  • Add a few more sounds
  • Improve several drawings

Perhaps the most important task today is animating Ploppy. We think that for this we need arounf 3000-4000$. The rest will be spent on improving the graphics and sounds in the game. 

If we get 20000$ we will add additional animations for Ploppy and other creatures.

If we get 30000$ we will add a 4th planet

If we get 40000$ we will start porting the game to Android

If you pay 50$ or more, you will get one of this t-shirts:

If you pay 400$ and more you will get book with comic strip from game:

The Impact

We believe our game will be fun and enjoyable by anyone aged 5 to 100. A cute hero in an unusual underwater world with incredible physics - the game is destined for success!

We will be grateful to anyone that supports us. Be it in form of money, or just a like on facebook or a tweet.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is important, but getting the attention of other people is just as important. This is why we will be infinitely grateful to those that spread the word, that tell their friends, cats and dogs about our game!

You could get some additional information or even ask us something by clicking one of links below:

story:
As you may or may not know, Beyond Entertainment is looking to launch a website and forum for the Halo/gaming community. The costs of building, launching, and sustaining a website as big as we envision ours being are very hard to shoulder on our own.

 

If you love what we do and want to help support the community, this could be a fantastic way to show it. No matter how passionate of a gamer you are, we are looking to include you in our community with open arms.

 

Thank you for your time and support, and Go Beyond!
story_txt:
As you may or may not know, Beyond Entertainment is looking to launch a website and forum for the Halo/gaming community. The costs of building, launching, and sustaining a website as big as we envision ours being are very hard to shoulder on our own.
 
If you love what we do and want to help support the community, this could be a fantastic way to show it. No matter how passionate of a gamer you are, we are looking to include you in our community with open arms.
 
Thank you for your time and support, and Go Beyond!

story:
The Idea was to test some streams during this U18 IIHF World Chamionship tournment. It worked well and the number of viewers were pretty Good... With very little promotion.

We had feedback from around the world... including requests to stream all the games of the final day.

Unfortunatelly, we also broke a camera during transport, so if we could be paying for the repairs together, it would be great.

SO IF YOU LIKED IT, IF YOU ENJOYED WATCHING YOUR SON, FRIEND, OR FAMILLY MEMBER PLAY THIS WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP, WE HOPE YOU'LL ALSO DO A SMALL DONATION.

IF YOU WANT TO PARTICPATE, YOU CAN DECIDE HOW MUCH YOU WANT TO GIVE.

That will be very helpfull in making sure we can continue this operation in the future.

 

Cheers

 

 

Nick

story:
Hey guys. 

I’m Muerte, a shitty excuse of a TF2 player. 

I had this bright idea of doing a rather…large…uncrating spree…1000 crates (500 Robo, 500 ‘normal’) to be exact, which will of course be livestreamed. 

Yeah, some of you might be thinking ‘Right, this guy is pretty fucking stupid for wasting all that money on a video game’.  The majority of the money invested in this incredibly stupid uncrate spree is ‘profit’ from trading TF2 items over a substantial period of time.  I considered simply cashing out but thought, ‘Why not have a little bit of fun?’

Now, I done some ridiculously hard mathematical calculations using Pythagoras and some other fancy shit and figured out that uncrating 1000 crates would take just over 4 hours (assuming the average time for each uncrate is 15 seconds; 7 seconds to navigate to each key, hit use, navigate to the crate, hit uncrate; 5 seconds for the uncrating animation/annoying as fuck noise; 3 seconds to admire the inevitable strange I obtain from the uncrate and click ok).  For this reason, alongside downright laziness in attempting to obtain the remaining keys required, I am splitting this uncrate spree into 2 segments of 500 crates.  The first half will occur sometime this weekend, most likely on Saturday (20/07/2013) at around 2pm GMT (Yeah, that’s London time) – I will keep this post updated with the time I intend to begin uncrating.  The second half?  Well, probably in a few weeks or so…who knows.

 

 

Raffle/Donations

I have decided to do a raffle too.  The first unusual I uncrate (if I even get one…you better give me one Valve -___-), no matter what it is (yes, even if it is a Burning Team Captain) will be the item which gets raffled.

A $5 donation will give you 1 entry into the raffle, $10 will give you 3 entries and $20 will give you 7.  If, for example, you choose to donate $50, you will receive 17 (7 + 7 + 3) entries into the raffle.

The raffle will close at whatever time I finish uncrating. 

Please ensure you put your Steam ID (in whatever format) when you donate.  This is done after payment has been sent.  A page will appear with the option to 'Leave a message for Mohsin Ahmed (me)'.  Enter your Steam ID there and tick 'Make Private'.  Failure to provide your Steam ID will simply make your donation anonymous and make it impossible to actually add you to the raffle.  Entries made AFTER the raffle has occurred will be considered donations (with obviously no actual entry into the raffle…since it’s already happened…).  The Indiegogo page will be up until Monday (22/07/2013).  The target has been set at $500, which is the minimum Indigogo will allow.  I seriously have no idea how much interest there will be, if any at all. 

Alongside this, the second random Steam ID to be pulled will receive my own Power Surge Ol’ Geezer (may not be in my own backpack at this current moment in time).    

Money from the raffle will be donated to ghos7ayama.  For those of you who are unaware of his current circumstances, please read this thread; http://teamfortress.tv/forum/thread/10185.  ghos7 is currently going through some troubling times and I feel donating to him as opposed to a ‘general’ charity better suits my personal ideals.  He is fully aware of what I am doing.  For the more skeptical of you, there has been plenty of proof/evidence provided within that thread, highlighting the legitimacy of ghos7’s current circumstances.

 

 

Important Links

So yeah.  That about rounds this up.  Below is a list of important links etc.  As mentioned already, the exact time of this spree is still being worked out.  I will update this post as often as possible.

My Stream - http://www.twitch.tv/mediocre_muerte

Why ghos7ayama - http://teamfortress.tv/forum/thread/10185

My alt account backpack (‘proof’ I have the resources) - http://backpack.tf/id/constipated_chicken

My actual backpack (likely place the Ol' Geezer will be) - http://backpack.tf/id/76561198001585006

 

 

ANY DONATIONS MADE FROM NOW WIL BE GREATLY APPRECIATED BUT WON'T PROVIDE ENTRY INTO THE RAFFLE; THE RAFFLE HAS ALREADY OCCURED.

story:
The Short and Sweet

We've all been in that situation where we are playing a new game, and you're going through some content that could use an extra hand. However, you don't know anyone who has the same game, or is online playing at the same time. We are hoping to alleviate that pain.

Our plan is to make a nexus for gamers to easily find others to play with, groups or clans to join, or people to join your group or clan.

Why Do We Need Your Help

Getting the word out, for the most part. Marketing is an expensive endeavor, one that I am personally funding, at the moment. I'd like to be able to ramp up advertisement of Looking For Gamers, to give you guys more people to play with!

Right now, we have a site up, and we are working diligently to give you guys the best experience possible. We have sign ups going right now (http://app.lfgame.rs/register/), so check it out.

We also need money to pay for design work... I'm a pretty solid developer, but I'm also just a developer. Unfortunately, I do not have any design skills. With your help, I'd be able to enlist those who can design to work on this site. 

If we don't meet our goals, all of the funds will be going towards marketing to get more people on the site, ensuring that we take care of our growing user base.

As this isn't a site that will require payment, your benefits will include:

  • $5 - A personal Thank You from Looking For Gamers
  • $10 - A personal Thank You from Looking For Gamers, along with a mention on the "Funding" page on the Looking For Gamers website.
  • $20 - A personal Thank You from Looking For Gamers, along with a mention in the "Bronze Sponsors" section on the "Funding" page.
  • $50 - A personal Thank You from Looking For Gamers, along with a mention in the "Silver Sponsors" section on the "Funding" page.
  • $100 - A personal Thank You from Looking For Gamers, along with a mention in the "Gold Sponsors" section on the "Funding" page.
  • $500 - A personal Thank You from Looking For Gamers, along with a mention in the "Platinum Sponsors" section on the "Funding" page.
Every dollar you pledge, you will receive two dollars in your account, to use on Looking For Gamers.
Right now, there isn't a ton you can do with your account balance. It's mostly related to Clans/Guilds/Pick up Groups. In the future, we will have more stuff for you to do with your balance.

Cant Contribute? You can still help!

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially, but if you can't, there are still ways you can help!

  • Spread the word! Share this page with your friends and family, and even random people!
  • Sign up on the site
  • Leave us messages for suggestions or comments!

story:
You can try the current game for free on Google Play or Appstore

We love anime!

The anime style update is a full visual improvement for an existing free game for mobile devices called OwO (Android / iOS phones and tablets).
The noble cause of the campaign is to update all the assets and some features of the game in order to make it more japanese - anime styled for all who love nice graphics and illustration.
The other main reason to do this is because we want to open to some backers the code of the game!, this in order to help people that want to make their own games or mod OwO itself (you have all our permission, only let us know).


First concept art of the OwO character in anime style (OwO-tan).

Final result.

OwO character, pixel art version for gifts.


What is owo actually? and what we want it to be?

OwO is a fun arcade game for mobile devices available for free (yay!) on Google Play and Appstore. The gameplay is very simple, you control a cute little fox to dash left or right in order to catch fruits and candies to make score points, the lose condition is being hit by a dropping bomb and the difficulty level is increased over time.

Transition between the regular assets and the anime assets.


The game was made by Julian Delgado (AKA owocat) and Christian Lindor (AKA Lindhen) in order to prove themselves they can do a game in two weekends (and it was on time).

In order to have awesome rewards we need your support, we all know that indie games stage is beign empowered so hard so we need all your love guys in order to beign supported and make this open source project come true.

Your name on the credits + be the first to play + the source code of the game!

All previous rewards + Exclusive HD wallpapers + An exclusive manga story!

All previous rewards + HD printable poster + HD PDF artbook!

All previous rewards + HD T-shirt designs (printable) + Create a skin + Custom art!

All previous rewards + Boss epic design + your name as Lord Master Commander!


Where the money goes

We are making sure that all rewards are gonna be shipped on time so we need some extra effort of the team to make this.



Risks & Challenges

We have worked furiously behind the scenes to ensure this project will proceed without a hitch, from having as much prepared as we can, before your support, to working with partners who we trust and who have an excellent reputation and track record in the industry.

FAQ

What do you exactly mean with an anime update?

OwO is actually a game on Google Play and App Store for Android and iOS devices, but we want to make a game evolution update on it in order to improve many things and make it more anime appealing. Literally the update is to add new assets to the game and some minnor features but preserving the actual assets too in order to allow the user to chosse between the traditional skin or the new anime one without affecting the gameplay.

With open source do you mean to open the code for all the people on the internet?
We want to open the source code for all the people for sure but for the moment we will do it only for backers from the Code Elite perk to all above tiers (practically all except founder hero).

Do you have any experience on the videogame industry?
Actually all the team has, we have been on the game industry for more than three years and know all the basics and some advanced techniques on how to make them, we are experienced mainly on the mobile games stage.


Other Ways You Can Help

Other ways you can help is by spreading the word , we'd love your friends to know us and realize that there are people who do what we love and we hope to do something big about it :)

Find us on facebook: <3


Many thanks! <3

With open source do you mean to open the code for all the people on the internet?We want to open the source code for all the people for sure but for the moment we will do it only for backers from the Code Elite perk to all above tiers (practically all except founder hero).
Do you have any experience on the videogame industry?Actually all the team has, we have been on the game industry for more than three years and know all the basics and some advanced techniques on how to make them, we are experienced mainly on the mobile games stage.

Other Ways You Can Help
 Other ways you can help is by spreading the word , we'd love your friends to know us and realize that there are people who do what we love and we hope to do something big about it :)
Find us on facebook: <3
Many thanks! <3

story:
Update 13/03/2012

Blog post here: http://minsktown.com/2012/03/12/animal-cage-progress-report-09032012/ 

Development blog post update, includes weekly view of environmental progress, features added, content & bug fixes. 

What is Animal Cage?

ANIMAL CAGE DEVELOPMENT BLOG
http://www.minsktown.com

Animal Cage is a First Person Survival Adventure set in a completely unique and inspired setting. It is being developed by MinskTown, a one-man indie game developer. 

Animal Cage sets itself 3 goals, which are:

  • Focus on a non-linear approach to story telling. Focusing on themes and setting; the players interpretation and actions craft the script.
  • The Free-form Adventure Genre. Taking traditional 'point & click adventure game' puzzle mechanics and expanding upon the original concept. For each puzzle in Animal Cage there are several solutions, solved by player's resourcefulness. 
  • A complete and true interactive system. Pull, push, drag, throw, carry, open, close, lock, crush, inspect, ignite, weld, extinguish and many more help you survive against the environment and the characters within Animal Cage.

Why the need for Animal Cage?

Games are not film, they are not music and they are not books. Games are a young art-form, and as a result have taking too much inspiration for storytelling from other media platforms.  My belief is that games can be much more than an interactive film, or a dialogue dispenser or just a linear path. 

There was a time before all other media existed, when man would walk the earth from settlement to settlement, exchanging stories and tales with the people he met. But not stories like we know exist in today's media. These stories were different. These stories were crafted with individuals. These stories were personal.

When telling a tale, these travelling storytellers would often be interrupted by someone wishing to add to the story. A comment by a viewer would add to their tale and the storytellers would embrace it, let it flesh out their story. By embracing the player's existence as a storyteller in games, we can move closer towards dynamic storytelling, like we had hundreds of years ago. 

What We Need & What You Get

As sole developer on this project I'm trading time with creative control. I'm predicting development to be finished around august time, and as a result will be needing money for food, rent and software costs. 


AT $2000

Animal Cage is being Developed using the basic (and also free) version of Unity3d Engine (http://unity3d.com/). The basic version limits the visual potential of this project greatly, if funding hits $2000 The pro version of Unity3d will be purchased. This will allow for Dynamic shadows, better particle effects and a complete overhaul of the lighting.


Who is MinskTown?

http://www.minsktown.com/

MinskTown is Greg Pryjmachuk. A indie games developer with 5 years professionally experience within the games industry. MinskTown is Greg's attempt to realise his alternate visions of what games could be.

Other Ways You Can Help

I am looking for a music composer for the soundtrack. If you cannot donate to this project, please get the word out about it to people that maybe can. Let us change how story telling is dealt with in games, let us allow players to express their creativity, their mood, their desires and their regrets. Lets free the player from the shackles of a movie script. Let's find out where this can go.

story:
I love the Robotics since I was a young boy: "Mom, when I'm BIG I will create a robot that washes the floor, washes the clothes and irons them for you".
 
Now I'm BIG! I studied Computer Engineering with a specialization in Robotics, I'm a Computer Vision expert and I know a lot about Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, so it is time to complete what I called... 

... the "MyzharBot Project"

MyzharBot will be your personal robot. You will be able to speak to it and it will recognize you and it will reply to your vocal commands.

MyzharBot will be a full autonomous robot, but you will be able to control/monitor it by your smartphone/tablet (Android, iOS and Windows) via WiFi, bluetooth and remotely by Internet.

Main Features

  • Brain: Pandaboard ES, dualcore ARM Cortex-9 miniPC
  • Operating System: Embedded Linux Ubuntu based
  • Power: LiIon 5000mA Turnigy Battery
  • Motors: 2x powerful Micro Motors series e192 – model e192-12-18 - Link - Datasheet
  • Motor Encoders: 2x CUI INC AMT102-V - Link - Datasheet
  • Motor Logic Unit: Robocontroller V2 - Link
  • Motor Power Unit: Roboponte-MD V2 - Link
  • Tracks: 2x Tracks LynxMotion 3″ width - Link
  • Chassis: Laser cut plastic chassis. Project on Ponoko site

Project State

MyzharBot's prototype is actually under developing. You can see a few of videos made during preliminar tests on Myzhar's channel on YouTube.

Here's a couple of MyzharBot's prototype photos: the hardware and the brain.

 

The chassis is defined and a first project is ready, but a few modifications must be studied to let it be more robust and let the hardware be well suited.

A lot of work must be done on the software side. Linux system must be configurated and MyzharBot software must evolve such to include Artificial Intelligence. The software framework will be based on ROS, a Robotic Framework developed by WillowGarage.

Computer Vision processing will be based on OpenCV library, the most complete and performat Computer Vision Library available. I love it!

The Control Unit (GUI) is ready for Desktop PC and must be ported to mobile platforms.

Here are three screenshoots of the Desktop PC GUI, based on Qt framework (debug, manual guide, real time telemetry):

 

Draft MyzharBot's Architecture

Next Steps

  • Funding 80$: MyzharBot will receive a website dedicated exclusively to the phases of its creation

  • Funding 150$: new laser cutted chassis. The new chassis will be 4mm tick instead of the current 3mm

  • Funding 300$: new aluminum reinforcements will be designed and manufactured by a CNC service

  • Funding 500$: obstacle sensors (bumpers, sonars, ir) will be selected, acquired and tested

  • Funding 1000$: embedded Linux Ubuntu based Operating system will be released on MyzharBot's site

  • Funding 1500$: Computer Vision algorithms will be released based on a webcam sensor: people detection, people recognition, road detection and so on

  • Funding 2000$: webcam will be replaced by an Asus Xtion Pro Live such to have 2D and 3D perception, computer vision algorithms will be enhanced by 3D elaboration based on PointCloud Library (PCL) (maybe that a second linux embedded board will be added to perform such elaborations)

  • Funding 3000$: vocal system will be developed including speech recognition and voice synthesizer

  • Funding 5000$: Android GUI will be developed

  • Funding 6000$: iOS GUI will be developed

  • Funding 8000$: the whole MyzharBot's system will be released as an open project with a complete documentation for each of the developed module

You can follow the MyzharBot project on Myzhar's blog

If you think that the project is interesting do not hesitate and fund it.

This is the T-Shirt that you will receive with funding of 35$:

Note: for supporters outside Italy and Europe there might be an additional shipping cost according to distance and weight of the package.

story:
The history of our project is rather simple. Back in 2008, several future members of our team - and at that time, old fans of the Command and Conquer games - were very unhappy with the recently released Red Alert 3, which they felt had buried a good game series. Together, these disgruntled fans started developing a mod called "Red Alter" for Command and Conquer 3: Tiberium Wars, which they hoped would demonstrate their ideas about the "right" Red Alert. We began with a fairly high level of quality and started to create our own universe for the project. A few years later, during the development of the mod, many members of our team had managed to accumulate a lot of experience and work as freelancers on a variety of small projects (many of which have not yet been announced). We realized that it was time to do something with our modification. The potential of our original universe was worthy of implementation on a separate engine and at an entirely new level.

In June 2012 our team decided to restart the project under a new name and develop a new, high quality indie game. At the same time we were joined by several experienced freelancers. So it was that Red Alter came to an end, but in it's place and with renewed vigour, Red March was born.

We named our team Bayonet Studio, and our motto is - "By gamers - for gamers!". This represents not only our attitude to Red March, but to games in general.

Red March is at it's heart an RTS, based on the legacy of the old-school strategy games such as Command and Conquer. But this is not just the clone of some old game! Red March intends to reconcile the old-fashioned gameplay with features of newer generation games, for example dynamic infantry cover. Micro-control of units will not be as important as the player's overall strategic plan and making the right decisions. In Red March, you will have to rely on your intelligence to overcome hordes of enemy units.

We feel that RTS developers have been playing around with the multiplayer part of their games too much in recent years at the expense of single-player and the over-all atmosphere of the game. Our team wants to to avoid this this, and focus on a story that will plunge the player into the universe of Red March. This will be achieved by FMV with live actors playing different characters. But we aren't forgetting multiplayer, as we intend to launch with a well constructed multiplayer mode, and following launch, we will closely monitor balance of units and release patches that address any issues with this balance.

The story of Red March is the the climax of the entirety of human conflicts - The Last World War. It was prepared for throughout the whole Cold War, and now, the war to end humanity has finally come true. Military technology has reached its goal - it has placed into the hands of mankind the most deadly arsenal in history. Weapons of mass destruction are brought on full alert and actively used, taking with them countless lives. Millions of soldiers have been sacrificed on the battlefields in futile attempts to turn the tide of the war. Every kilometer of land is stained with blood and paid for by the lives of soldiers. This monstrous meat-grinder extends across the entire globe. In these dark times, heroism and recklessness are synonymous, and human life is worth nothing, even though war is being waged in the name of people. War rages in the blood of humanity, and after this, the final war, the winners will not be left with a happy ending, only survivors. This is the atmosphere which we will instil into the project.

Communists, Capitalists, and a mysterious third side all vie to kill each other in the quest for world domination. Whose side are you on?

Unlike most RTS games involving the participation of the Soviet Union, we do not want to turn the USSR into the clown-like characters, the classic bad guys. Our style is extremely grim and serious, with no room for satire. In Red March, no side will be the "Good guys".

Of course, while we can not disclose details of the plot and script, we want to assure you that it will fully comply with the spirit of our game. In this universe there is no place to charity, there is only ruthless brutality, survival and endless war. In creating the universe of Red March, we were inspired by the darkest sci-fi settings in order to create a truly living world.

In style and design, Red March will be a mix of many areas, ranging from dieselpunk and atompunk, to the influence of the style of the 60s.

We guarantee to pay heed to and provide a constant medium for feedback from fans and investors after collecting funding. Each month, on our blog and on our website, (which at the time of writing is still being completed) we will post reports (possibly with video) on what work we have done and we'll continue to discuss our plans. Hence we will be constantly talking about the course of our development from the outset, and backers will be able to see what their money is actually going to do.

According to our current plans, the game will be released in the form of electronic copies and distributed through Steam (if we are approved by potential buyers in the Steam Greenlight or make an agreement with Valve). But even if for some reason we will not be able to sell the game through Steam, we will be selling Red March through our own website. In addition, our backers will have the opportunity to get a boxed collector's version of the game stored on disk and several additional materials.

We are also considering a freeware-version of the game with a multiplayer game and some removed content. This is our response to piracy, as we realise that our game will most likely be broken and laid on torrent websites, but we look forward to maintaining a good relationship with the players. If a player is interested in our game, they can try the game in the freeware-version, and then purchase the full version of the game if they enjoy it.

Our initial task is to make a russian and english version of the game at first. If we'll be funded succesfully, we'll translate Red March on other languages.

In addition, if a publisher was interested in publishing our game in this format, we will consider proposals. However, we are focused primarily on digital distribution, and on the boxed collectors edition of the game.

Now our key platform is PC, Windows only. Porting on other OS's or platforms depends on success of your funding.

Most of the money will go, of course, on salaries and the hiring of additional workers, such as programmers since our current team is not yet large enough to develop this project from scratch. The current team consists mainly of residents of post-Soviet space, and there are many reasons why game development in Russia is much cheaper than in Western countries. This fact allows for a great saving on budget, as in the U.S, development of such a game would cost two or three times our asking price (not to mention spending that would go on marketing).

Unlike large publishers and developers, we do not intend to spend a great deal on marketing and advertising of the game, as we hope instead that the support of fans and their enthusiasm will spread the word of our game. As such, we will focus almost the entirety of the budget on the development of the game.

The engine for our game is currently not selected, but we have a short list of candidates. The final decision in choosing the engine will have to depend on the amount of money collected in this campaign.

However, we are prepared that in the event we collect more than the required minimum amount ($ 350,000), then we are ready to do the following:

$ 450,000 - We will be able to Improve the visuals of the game - better graphics and special effects, and therefore a better overall quality of the game. There can also be an expanded game world, and we will add more terrain and theatres of war. We will also be able to add more neutral objects to maps, and so the game world as a whole would become more detailed.

$ 600,000 - We will be able to release an SDK for modding. We respect both fans and developers who are trying to make their games available for modifying and allowing their own fans to create game content. So why can we not just release the SDK and the game? The fact is that since we are not creating our own engine, and are buying the license for it, therefore the tools of the engine will only be available to us under the contract. We therefore would have to create separate tools for our fans to be able to modify the resources of Red March. In addition, an SDK created for fans needs to be much more convenient and simple than the specialised tools used by developers.

Further funding would allow us to consider additional developments such as additional destructible scenery elements and more detailed physics, better in-game cinematics, development for Mac and Linux platforms, further campaigns and faction add-ons, in addition to a host of other improvements.

Obviously, giving us even just a couple of dollars will help, and donating more will qualify you for certain rewards (See the rewards section below) In addition to investing money, you can greatly help our project by spreading information about it. Please tell your friends about us and our campaign.

As you already know, the world is a very difficult economic situation and many publishers of video games have had problems with their finances. To avoid risk, the norm recently has been to create games in a more traditional form for mainstream gamers. Red March is not the same, and is not created for the mass of players; Instead, our target audience is players who enjoy old-school titles. Publishers of video games would not give us much money for our development, and if they did, would most likely interfere with our concept, to simplify the game for mainstream players and customers. Therefore, we chose сrowd funding as the source of funds for our development.

Initially, we thought we would put our project on Kickstarter, but there are many problems associated with the placement of projects from outside the USA. Indiegogo, however, is much more accessible and easier to use for young teams outside the USA, and that was the basis for our decision to place the campaign here.

We will also be able to add more neutral objects to maps, and so the game world as a whole would become more detailed.
$ 600,000 - We will be able to release an SDK for modding. We respect both fans and developers who are trying to make their games available for modifying and allowing their own fans to create game content. So why can we not just release the SDK and the game? The fact is that since we are not creating our own engine, and are buying the license for it, therefore the tools of the engine will only be available to us under the contract. We therefore would have to create separate tools for our fans to be able to modify the resources of Red March. In addition, an SDK created for fans needs to be much more convenient and simple than the specialised tools used by developers.
Further funding would allow us to consider additional developments such as additional destructible scenery elements and more detailed physics, better in-game cinematics, development for Mac and Linux platforms, further campaigns and faction add-ons, in addition to a host of other improvements.

Obviously, giving us even just a couple of dollars will help, and donating more will qualify you for certain rewards (See the rewards section below) In addition to investing money, you can greatly help our project by spreading information about it. Please tell your friends about us and our campaign.

As you already know, the world is a very difficult economic situation and many publishers of video games have had problems with their finances. To avoid risk, the norm recently has been to create games in a more traditional form for mainstream gamers. Red March is not the same, and is not created for the mass of players; Instead, our target audience is players who enjoy old-school titles. Publishers of video games would not give us much money for our development, and if they did, would most likely interfere with our concept, to simplify the game for mainstream players and customers. Therefore, we chose сrowd funding as the source of funds for our development.
Initially, we thought we would put our project on Kickstarter, but there are many problems associated with the placement of projects from outside the USA. Indiegogo, however, is much more accessible and easier to use for young teams outside the USA, and that was the basis for our decision to place the campaign here.

story:
Hi!

Welcome to our work-in-progress which is an action-puzzle game for touchscreen devices.

The game is about an ordinary chicken family lost in space. After being abducted and turned into squares, they wake up high above the Earth, inside the stomach of an edgy lifeform.

You will play along with Pollo, the chicken mother who is rather unhappy as a square. Her biggest wish is to find her baby squares and return them to Earth as round chickens. Pollo’s second biggest wish is to regain roundness herself in shape and state of mind.

Who are we?

We are a small team of newbie game makers with different backgrounds.
Initiator and funder: Mikael Behrenfors
Programmer and designer: Jacob Ulmert
Graphician and designer: Gustav Björklind

Why crowdfunding?

Initially, Mikael’s idea was to create games for younger children, which led to the release of Waka Space, but our current project grew more complex and eventually exhausted the budget. In this stage of development, as our first demo is ready, we need to know how you feel about the game: Does it look like something you would like to play? Do you find it meaningful? This campaign is an inquiry for our first beta release; Donations will be like votes for the game to be finalized.

Genres and influences

After prototyping a lot, we settled for a combination of puzzler, platformer / maze, shoot-em-up and sci-fi adventure. Many games have been influential, most apparently classics like Laser Chess, Unblock Me, Sokoban, Space Invaders and Super Mario Bros.

Gameplay

As you move and jump around, you will encounter blocks that make up puzzles you have to solve. The most common type is the ordinary Movable block. Use your fingers to interact with them.

As you touch a movable block, markers will indicate where the block will go when you release your finger.

Movable blocks are your friends. Actually, they are innocent lifeforms from Earth who have been turned into squares just like Pollo. They will gladly assist as much as they can, but will need your decisions and input.

Some blocks have to be “created” in order to be solid and movable.

Some blocks must be blown away with laser, some will explode as you tap them and some can be used as elevators when Pollo is on top.

Save all children from squareness and send them back to Earth!




Avoid spiky surfaces and liquids.


Collect keys for locks, and crystals to get extra points.

Guards are programmed by the alien to turn rebellious squares like you back to sleep. As you defeat them, they will regain their original, round shapes and live happily ever after!

Laser blows away rocks and defeats guards. Tap any laser button to fire in four directions. Notice the bouncing against diagonal blocks - it can be useful when fighting various flying enemies (planned for the final version).

Beam blocks are dangerous, but also helpful.


In some puzzles you will be able to toggle solid blocks on and off by tapping them. In this case it is the only way to get the key without losing too much health.

As a square, you will often need to take part in puzzles.

In some places you have to use bombs to get through. But don't worry - nobody gets hurt!


Investigate the scenes and start figuring things out. In this situation, the turret was placed one step higher to blow away the rocks blocking the keys.

In this part of the game you will have to safely bring the chickens to the top of the level where the exit is. The icons at the top right of the screen indicate that you have to rescue two more chicken babies to complete the level.

Some sections contain more action which will make you practise reflexes and precision while other parts challenge your problem solving skills.

As we merge those elements of puzzle and action, an entertaining mix appears. The end section of a level will often include both puzzle blocks and harder enemy resistance. Diagonals will be helpful if you align them to increase and direct laser firepower.

Donations will be used for...

Continued development:
- Administration of beta testing rounds
- Implementation of changes suggested by testers
- Improving character and enemy movement / behaviour
- Making Pollo come alive by adding more facial expressions / events
- Designing and implementing flying enemies including modular bosses
- Cleaning up dialogue design and behaviour
- Designing a tutorial screen for gameplay
- Polishing and developing special effects where needed
- Making cover graphics, like icons and posters
- Fixing bugs and glitches
- Optimizing for speed, size and different screen resolutions

Level design:
- Designing levels and puzzles to make a full game - the goal being 15 levels / 5 chapters
- Making decoration layers
- Finishing one color theme / world for each chapter
- Writing dialogues

Music and sound:
- Hiring Goto80 to develop music and sound effects

Crowdfunding:
- Designing and distributing perks

Big thanks to

- Friends and family
- The Defold team and game engine
- Goto80 (and Pingipung Records) who’s music we've borrowed for the demo and campaign video
- Ingo, speaker voice in the video
- Yusuke Kamiyamane, maker of the Tempesta font

About perks

- In order to get a Thank You perk you have to donate publicly
- Check the media gallery to get a hint about poster and t-shirt designs
