story:
Crest - Now on Forever Funding

Crest has reached its goal and we are currently working on the final version of it. We have decided to participate in Indiegogo's Forever Funding program, meaning that the campaign will be open for more contributions until March when we begin our early access stage. Our original plan for our crowdfunding was that it would cover part of our budget, but not all of it (and that the rest of the budget would come from loans and investors). Luckily for us we now have gotten a loan and we have enough funds to be able to continue our production of Crest. We got a budget, but it's a tight one.

Your contributions would help us establish a buffer and also buy us time to polish and iterate our game, in short, help us make Crest as good as possible. We see this as a chance for our current and new fans who have missed the campaign to contribute, but also an opportunity for our supporters that want to contribute more to be able to do that. Thank you to all of our supporters who have helped us get so far, Crest is on its way!

We restarted the perks for the Forever Funding, so that's why there's no visible claims from the older funders. However, we want to underline that all previous claims to perks will be redeemed of course.


What is Crest?

Crest is a god game where expression is the key, creative problem solving is your tools and the goal is to create interesting interactions and consequences. Witness a world populated by your followers, wholly autonomous entities that live their own lives and have their own ways they behave. Your inclusion into the game is to provide a higher reason for their continued existence, help them along the way, plan ahead what you want them to become, see how they evolve and how your relationship with them grows. Crest is developed for Windows, OS X and Linux.



We hope you have taken time out to watch our pitch video. It should be noted that gameplay from the video is taken from our prototype of Crest, and should not be a representative of what the full version of Crest will look like or function. We encourage you to try out the prototype for yourself if you are interested in how the game plays out at this stage of development.



When you've tried the prototype we encourage you to leave feedback. Since we're still early in the game's development now is the best time to tell us what you think. We're interested to hear everything from bugs to what you'd think would be nice to see in the future.


Crest's method of input is writing commandments. These commandments are rule sets for your followers, describing what actions they should take if certain conditions are met. Commandments can be used as orders. Safety valves to deal with possible future situations. They can be linked together to create more defined outcomes amongst other things.


How your followers will respond to your commandments is not a sure thing however. Followers have many attributes that deal with how they interact with your commandments. They may forget your commandments. Revert back to how they used to live their lives once a commandment fades from memory. They may even take what words you have written and translate them to try and extract the real meaning behind it. See how their vision of their God develops and how they attempt to figure out your grand master plan for them.



One of our goals with Crest is to create an engine for history creation. While in the earlier stages of the game your focus may be on seeing to it that your followers survive, that they have enough food to support themselves, eventually the game will proceed to higher areas of discussion than just basic needs. Your goal will be to shape society in a way you find interesting and see how your followers will act. Events that happened before will have consequences on forthcoming generations; remembrance of hard times may cause followers who lived through these periods to be more adamant about saving their food and cautious of expanding their tribe.




Expressing yourself in Crest is done through your people. Your people have characteristics that modify their behavior, and in correlation with their other characteristics form the essence of their being. Other factors do favor into their decision-making. Young, happy followers with high Chastity characteristic may work very hard to provide food (maybe enough to provide for the entire city) but will not contribute towards producing the next generation. Old followers with high Greed characteristic may be too old to work and will constantly take all the food the young followers produce for their own use. In Crest your goal is to try and tailor your followers behavior to your liking, and their characteristics is one of their defining traits that you need to think about.



  • Creative and easy input with varied consequences - Writing commandments for your followers is easy and will have a huge impact on their lives. You write statements that will trigger actions under specific conditions. If you write commandments that are sensible to the people your commandments may survive unfiltered throughout the ages whereas other commandments may be interpreted in new ways and may provide disastrous implications for future generations.
  • Many ways of expression - Crest is about what you want your people to become; there will be situations that you can solve in several ways, but no real inherent right or wrong. It’s about experimenting and expressing yourself; through seeing how you can shape your people, and how they in turn, shape history.
  • Partake in the legacy of the world – The world and everything in it will change over time, long periods of fruitful harvest may lead to better chances for forthcoming generations. Artifacts telling the stories of times passed will decorate the scene. Your people will evolve, and you may need to evolve along with them.
  • Indirect control – Your followers are autonomous and have their own behaviors, preferences and needs that will dictate how they act in the world. Your commandments are also viewed through their perspective, they may reinterpret what you say and if they dislike your actions as a God they may even turn against you!
  • Procedurally generated content - The world will be randomly generated to ensure that each playthrough will begin with different conditions for your followers. Cities built in deserts will behave differently from cities in areas with heavy vegetation and so forth. The initial surroundings and the lay of the land will play a definite part in the forthcoming development.


    Our team has worked on Crest since October 2013. Much of the time spent on Crest has been done without pay, next to studies and other work. Luckily, some members have been able to dedicate themselves fully to the game from time to time and a few of our members saved up money in order to be able to work full time during this summer. We now have reached a point where we have something we can show you which will give a glimpse of what Crest could be.

    Everybody on the team is passionate about seeing Crest come to fruition. What we are hoping to achieve with this campaign is not only to raise funds in order to see this happen, but also come in closer contact with our current fans and find new ones. We want you to be as excited about Crest as we are and hope to see it materialize.


    Thanks to the generous contributions of our followers and a loan from Almi, a Swedish incubator, we have enough money to keep us afloat until May. We're currently working full time on developing Crest, but we wish to have more time in order to create a more immersive product.


    Our goal with our campaign was not for you to fund our whole production. We have now also received funding from our municipality and Almi as mentioned above. Obviously, the more sources of funding we can secure, the longer we can spend on producing Crest. Crest will be released, right now its just a question of how big it can become.

      As of today, we have 4 employees. We also employ consultants. When it comes to personnel cost, we calculate with a monthly cost of around 7000 USD. This is, obviously, the largest chunk of our costs and will dictate how long we can spend on developing Crest. Our other costs (bank, rent, fees) amounts to 150 USD / month. For marketing, we plan on investing a total sum of 100-200 USD / month. Additional licenses will amount to 3000 USD. We mostly use open source software to produce our assets. This is our current budget breakdown:


       
      Instead of increasing our low minimum wages we will use the extra income to be able to extend working on it as many months as we are able to make a better game. Your contributions would give us more time to work on Crest and help us out with all other costs that quickly pile up during game production.

      Supporting Crest financially doesn't just mean getting us closer to being able to deliver this game to you, but will also help us establish ourselves as an indie game studio that focuses on innovative games we feel is missing from the market. Our plan is to stay in the business for as long as we can. If we raise above our intended goal, it means we get more funding into our studio without strings attached; we will be less dependent towards third parties and can spend more time polishing Crest.



      We’re Eat Create Sleep, a small indie studio situated on an island called Gotland (Sweden) in the Baltic Sea. Apart from Roland who has previous experience in professional game development as an audio designer, the other four of us are graduate students from Uppsala University, with bachelor degrees in game design. We’ve all spent years with making smaller experimental games and have now moved on to make a commercial career out of our studies.



      We strive to be a studio that take the game medium further and create more meaningful experiences in the game scene. To achieve this we take risks both when it comes to theme and on the way we produce them, but we never reinvent the wheel just for laughs. We’re deeply rooted in game history and conventions, but we aim to explore new paths.

      Before we started making Crest, a part of the team started making their first full featured game. Oskar and Martin met in 2012 at their university and started on the ecological management simulation game Among Ripples early 2013. We learned a lot about polishing a project and taking it all the way from start to finish. It was released in the beginning of April, 2014 and has garnered a lot of positive feedback since then.

      We’ve appeared on several outlets with positive reviews and have several impressions on Youtube. The game is available for free and can be downloaded right away, so don’t take our word for it. During the later stage of production for Among Ripples we rallied more creative and brave people behind us and started on our new vision, Crest. A continuation on our first game in more than one way.



      If you want to know more about us you could always play our behind the scenes RPG "Eat Create Sleep Adventures!". Become our producer for a second and partake in our journey. Incidentally the soundtrack for ECSA is available as a perk.





      "Your followers need to build, harvest, eat, reproduce, die, and all that god game stuff, directed by Your intervention."
      - Alice O'Connor, Rock, Paper, Shotgun

      "[...]the possibility for an interesting AI-driven look at morality, sociology, and human interaction is there."
      - Bob Reinhard, Artistry in Games

      "Many of my friends enjoy playing The Sims like they’re watching an ant colony: Hardly interfering, merely observing. I, as a video game control freak, prefer to engineer their life. Eat Create Sleep is creating something that’s in between those playstyles."
      - Luke Siuty, Indie Game Magazine

      "Crest appears to be a very interesting twist on the god game formula."
      - Cyber, Death by Beta

      "I can’t really think of a game that mirrors this style of play quite in the same way. It has the potentiality to become something pretty big, especially depending on how far through civilization Crest will allow your people/tribe/world to evolve."
      - William Usher, One Angry Gamer


      First and foremost we are grateful for anything you are willing to contribute to our cause. The perks themselves we see as mere incentives to support us, we hope that you are supporting us because you believe in our game, but we hope that the perks themselves are satisfactory as well. All the higher tiers will fetch all perks below it, for example if you claim the Crest Strategy Guide you will also get the ECSA soundtrack and get access to a free copy of the game.

















      We're a newly founded indie outfit and have to face the worries of getting everything to run smoothly. Everything from acquiring all the necessary funding to establishing the administrative side of running a studio. But we see this as a natural part of starting up, and have taken precautions to follow through.



      Besides monetary contributions we welcome you to share the campaign, online and offline. There are links at the top of the page, below the video, that allows you to easily share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and Google Plus.

      We really appreciate all the help we can get and getting the word out is just as important as the contributions themselves.


      What is the goal of Crest?
      Crest invites the player to define his/her own goal. If all your followers die you will lose the game, but Crest is not a game where you constantly struggle for survival. During play testing some players have opted for goals such as trying to spread their civilization as much as possible or trying to maintain a balance in the community. We hope the full version will inspire you to experiment and reach for whatever goal you feel is interesting.

      How long can a game session be?
      Crest has no set time limit, players are free to play for as long as they like. Our goal with Crest is to offer gameplay that will keep the player invested in the same session for a substantial amount of time.

      How does player and followers communicate?
      The player will communicate with the followers by commandments; telling them how to behave and how to react in specific situations. The followers will give feedback to the player, ranging from how their work day went to their needs and how they feel about their god. The player is free to ignore or try to appease the people, it will not entirely be clear at all times what actions will better their disposition.

      What is missing from the prototype that will be in the full version?
      The design of the full version of Crest is still dependent on how much funding we can secure. What we want is more immersive feedback, more focus on the gameplay evolving to higher levels as time goes by. More ways to express yourself through your commandments. More interactions between the followers and the world that they populate. A substantial late-game experience that will keep the player invested in the history that will play out.

      Is Crest going to be alpha funded?
      Hopefully. What platform we will use we cannot say yet.

      Why are you not asking for money for the whole production?
      We do not wish to rely entirely upon the generosity of our fans; with your invaluable support we feel we can attain funding from other sources and not ask you for everything. We believe the sum we have set for the campaign is attainable for our fans, both new ones we will gain and our old ones.

      How much is Crest going to cost?
      We are currently unsure of what price we will attach to Crest, the price will vary based on what we value the end product. We want a fair price based on both our target audience and the work effort we have put in.

      What platforms are Crest going to be released on?
      Our ambitions is to release it on Steam, Desura, Humble Store and itch. Once we get to post-production we may want to release it for more platforms however. What we want is to have it accessible on many sites so our fans have the option to choose a platform they feel comfortable with.

      Is Crest going to be DRM-protected?
      Apart from the Steam version (if we get greenlit) there will be no required DRM to play our game. So if you don't want it on Steam, then you won't need to worry.

      What languages will Crest be released in?
      Due to the uncertainty of Crest's future we are focused right now on just developing a full version we feel does justice to the concept; so we are settling for just an English release. If we have the time, money and resources once we have finished Crest it is a definite possibility however to translate it into other languages.

      Will Crest be released for tablets or other platforms in the future?
      We do not currently have plans for it, but if the fans want it we are open to investigate how migrating the game to other platforms would affect the experience. It's a possibility.

      Why does the Early Access perk cost so much compared to the Game perk?
      Our perks are not pre-order products, but incentives for supporting our crowdfunding. All our perks above 15$ give the funder a peek into the process of Crest before it's released as a full game. Our intention is to get the early adopters onboard, those who believe so strongly in us that they think they can safely spend a higher amount.

      Since we don't treat the perks as pre-order products they do not represent the final price tag when Crest has become a product.

      Is your game inspired by god game X?
      The game is inspired above all by religion and ancient history, and not so much by any specific game. That's how we usually do at ECS, we prefer to start from scratch. But when we've looked at mechanics for inspiration we've looked at The Sumer Game/Hammurabi, Dwarf Fortress, The Civilization series and City Building games such as Pharaoh.
story_txt:
Crest - Now on Forever FundingCrest has reached its goal and we are currently working on the final 
version of it. We have decided to participate in Indiegogo's Forever Funding program, meaning that the campaign will be open for more contributions until March when we begin 
our early access stage. Our original plan for our
 crowdfunding was that it would cover part of our budget, but not all of
 it (and that the rest of the budget would come from loans and 
investors). Luckily for us we now have gotten a loan and we have enough funds to be able to continue our 
production of Crest. We got a budget, but it's a tight one.Your contributions would help us establish a buffer 
and also buy us time to polish and iterate our game, in short, help us 
make Crest as good as possible. We see this as a chance for our current and new
 fans who have missed the campaign to contribute, but also an 
opportunity for our supporters that want to contribute more to be able 
to do that. Thank you to all of our supporters who have helped us get so far, Crest is on its way!We restarted the perks for the Forever Funding, so that's why there's no visible claims from the older funders. However, we want to underline that all previous claims to perks will be redeemed of course.What is Crest?Crest is a god game where expression is the
key, creative problem solving is your tools and the goal is to create
interesting interactions and consequences. Witness a world populated
by your followers, wholly autonomous entities that live their own
lives and have their own ways they behave. Your
inclusion into the game is to provide a higher reason for their
continued existence, help them along the way, plan ahead what you
want them to become, see how they evolve and how your relationship
with them grows. Crest is developed for Windows, OS X and Linux.


We hope you have taken time out to watch our pitch video. It
should be noted that gameplay from the video is taken from our
prototype of Crest, and should not be a representative of what the
full version of Crest will look like or function. We encourage you to try out the prototype for yourself if you are interested in how the game plays
out at this stage of development. 










When you've tried the prototype we encourage you to leave feedback. Since we're still early in the game's 
development now is the best time to tell us what you think. We're 
interested to hear everything from bugs to what you'd think would be 
nice to see in the future.


Crest's method of input is writing commandments. These
commandments are rule sets for your followers, describing what actions
they should take if certain conditions are met. Commandments can be
used as orders. Safety valves to deal with possible future
situations. They can be linked together to create more defined
outcomes amongst other things. How your followers will respond to
your commandments is not a sure thing however. Followers have many
attributes that deal with how they interact with your commandments. They may forget your commandments. Revert back to how they used to
live their lives once a commandment fades from memory. They may even take
what words you have written and translate them to try and extract the
real meaning behind it. See how their vision of their God develops
and how they attempt to figure out your grand master plan for them.One of our goals with Crest is to create an engine for history
creation. While in the earlier stages of the game your focus may be
on seeing to it that your followers survive, that they have enough
food to support themselves, eventually the game will proceed to
higher areas of discussion than just basic needs. Your goal will be
to shape society in a way you find interesting and see how your
followers will act. Events that happened before will have
consequences on forthcoming generations; remembrance of hard times may cause followers who lived through these periods to be more adamant about saving their food and cautious of expanding their tribe.Expressing yourself in
Crest is done through your people. Your people have characteristics
that modify their behavior, and in correlation with their other
characteristics form the essence of their being. Other factors do
favor into their decision-making. Young, happy followers with high
Chastity characteristic may work very hard to provide food (maybe
enough to provide for the entire city) but will not contribute
towards producing the next generation. Old followers with high
Greed characteristic may be too old to work and will constantly take all the food
the young followers produce for their own use. In Crest your goal is to try and tailor your followers behavior to your liking, and their characteristics is one of their defining traits that you need to think about.















Creative and easy input with varied consequences - Writing
commandments for your followers is easy and will have a huge impact on 
their
lives. You write statements that will trigger actions under specific 
conditions. If you write commandments that are sensible to the
people your commandments may survive unfiltered throughout the ages 
whereas other commandments may be interpreted in new ways and may 
provide
disastrous implications for future generations.

Many ways of expression - 

Crest is
about what you want your people to become; there will be situations that you
can solve in several ways, but no real inherent right or wrong. It’s about
experimenting and expressing yourself; through seeing how you can shape your
people, and how they in turn, shape history.


Partake in the legacy of the world – The
world and everything in it will change over time, long periods of fruitful
harvest may lead to better chances for forthcoming generations. Artifacts
telling the stories of times passed will decorate the scene. Your people will
evolve, and you may need to evolve along with them.

Indirect control – Your
followers are autonomous and have their own behaviors, preferences and needs
that will dictate how they act in the world. Your commandments are also viewed
through their perspective, they may reinterpret what you say and if they
dislike your actions as a God they may even turn against you!

Procedurally generated content - The
world will be randomly generated to ensure that each playthrough will
begin with different conditions for your followers. Cities built in deserts will behave differently from cities in areas with heavy vegetation and so forth. The initial surroundings and the lay of the land will play a definite part in the forthcoming development.

 Our team has worked on Crest since October 2013. Much of the time spent on Crest has been done without pay, next to studies and other work. Luckily, some members have been able to dedicate themselves fully to the game from time to time and a few of our members saved up money in order to be able to work full time during this summer. We now have reached a point where we have something we can show you which will give a glimpse of what Crest could be.Everybody on the team is passionate about seeing Crest come to fruition. What we are hoping to achieve with this campaign is not only to raise funds in order to see this happen, but also come in closer contact with our current fans and find new ones. We want you to be as excited about Crest as we are and hope to see it materialize.



Thanks to the generous contributions of our followers and a loan from Almi, a Swedish incubator, we have enough money to keep us afloat until May. We're currently working full time on developing Crest, but we wish to have more time in order to create a more immersive product. 


Our goal with our campaign was not for you to fund our whole production. We have now also received funding from our municipality and Almi as mentioned above. Obviously, the more sources of funding we can secure, the longer we can spend on producing Crest. Crest will be released, right now its just a question of how big it can become.






As of today, we have 4 employees. We also employ consultants. When
 it comes to personnel cost, we calculate with a monthly cost of around 
7000 USD. This is, obviously, the largest chunk of our costs and 
will dictate how long we can spend on developing Crest. Our other 
costs (bank, rent, fees) amounts to 150 USD / month. For marketing, 
we plan on investing a total sum of 100-200 USD / month. Additional 
licenses will amount to 3000 USD. We mostly use open source software 
to produce our assets. This is our current budget breakdown:

 
Instead of increasing our low minimum wages we will use the extra income to be able to extend working on it as many months as we are able to make a better game. Your contributions would give us more time to work on Crest and help us out with all other costs that quickly pile up during game production.

Supporting Crest financially doesn't just mean getting us closer to 
being able to deliver this game to you, but will also help us establish 
ourselves as an indie game studio that focuses on innovative games we feel is missing from the market. Our plan is to stay in the business for as long as we can. If we raise above our intended goal, it means we get more funding into our studio without strings attached; we will be less dependent towards third parties and can spend more time polishing Crest.
  



We’re Eat Create Sleep, a small indie studio situated on an island called Gotland (Sweden) in the Baltic Sea. Apart from Roland who has previous experience in professional game development as an audio designer, the other four of us are graduate students from Uppsala University, with bachelor degrees in game design. We’ve all spent years with making smaller experimental games and have now moved on to make a commercial career out of our studies. 


We strive to be a studio that take the game medium further and create more meaningful experiences in the game scene. To achieve this we take risks both when it comes to theme and on the way we produce them, but we never reinvent the wheel just for laughs. We’re deeply rooted in game history and conventions, but we aim to explore new paths.

We’ve appeared on several outlets with positive reviews and have several impressions on Youtube. The game is available for free and can be downloaded right away, so don’t take our word for it. During the later stage of production for Among Ripples we rallied more 
creative and brave people behind us and started on our new vision, 
Crest. A continuation on our first game in more than one way. 
If you want to know more about us you could always play our behind the scenes RPG "Eat Create Sleep Adventures!". Become our producer for a second and partake in our journey. Incidentally the soundtrack for ECSA is available as a perk.

story:
We kindly welcome you to this campaign to get funding for Devious. We need as much help as possible to make this project see the light of day. Your support is much appreciated as we will continue to grow and make this project a reality.

Of course we encourage you to tell your friends about this if you think they can find it interesting!

Devious is a 2D story-driven turn based RPG game. Basically, we have a mix of many classic RPG elements and a modern plot with a lot of features and twists. We take influences from the most relevant and important RPGs from both West and East. 

Our ideal is to revive the turn based combat that we all love and bring it to computer gaming, wrapping it in with a deep concept, story and beautiful 2D graphics.

The player will take the place of agent David Doyle of the CDA in his attempt to capture a dangerous criminal, with the help of the advanced and classified intelligence system: OUTLAW Project.


1951, United States. The CIA conduced several experiments which lead to the creation of the MK Ultra Project. Its purpose was mind control over subjects through the use of substances, psychotherapy, sensory deprivation and many other questionable techniques.

A few years later, the project was halted due to the controversy generated, and nothing else was known about it.

What people didn't know was that the government of the United States created another agency whose sole purpose was to be the research and testing of experimental weapons and equipment for warfare. It was named by the cover code 'CDA'.

This organization was kept in secret and used for the most obscure operations. Using mind-controlled criminals and innovative weapons they were the unofficial unit for the most important off the record manhunts of the nation.

Devious will tell the story of one of the seven Project OUTLAW operatives, a man called David Doyle, who is assigned to capture the ex-CDA agent Raymond Clement.

A few years ago, Raymond Clement disappeared in a mission. Apparently, intelligence determined that he defected and joined an unidentified extremist group. Fast forward to present time, the President was kidnapped and he was seen on scene soon after. David will have to find the president and eliminate Raymond, keeping the kidnapping a secret to prevent the CDA existence to be revealed to the public.


What is Raymond motivation? Is there anything else that we don't know about this CDA agency? There's only a way to figure it out. By playing the game!

David Doyle (35): Agent of the CDA, expert in the use of OUTLAW technology. Before joining the agency he was part of the US Marshals Service. After his brother committed suicide, he was deeply depressed and couldn't keep the job. He was fired and the recruiters decided he could be an useful agent. He also wears a moustache. Although that's not really relevant.

Raymond Clement (48): Former CDA agent, now missing and extremely dangerous. Joined the OUTLAW Project after losing his eye in a military operation as a Navy SEAL sniper. He's the main antagonist of Devious.

Rebecca Templeton (29): Neuropsychiatrist assigned to David's command in order to tune the control technologies he employs.

Kai Hale (27): Intelligence operator and coordinator assigned to David's command. She will help him through the missions giving important insight.

Hans Nilsen (29): The young son of the Elkhound Security company. Hired by Raymond to recruit his mercenaries. He doesn't care about anything but money.

Nika (25): Raymond's right hand and formidable assassin. Trained by Raymond after he saved her from a Russian prison. She's devoted to him and would follow every order. She blames the world for the torture she suffered which lead to her losing the left arm.

Bertrand (Unknown): Mysterious looking man working for Raymond. His intentions are unknown, and he goes by the codename of 'Bertrand'. Nothing else is known about his past.

Laureen (24): One of the controlled criminals deployed by David. Daughter of a politician, she used to be an arsonist. Cheerful and odd person, might get in troubles sometimes but definitely a reliable resource when it comes to combat.

There are many more characters that will get announced every week through updates. Stay tuned for that!



Combat

We want to focus in a dynamic gameplay. Usually, for most people, turn based combat RPGs translates to slow, press 'any button' to win or just 'grindfest'. So we try to work on a system complex enough to make the battles strategic but at the same time fast and reactive. 

First of all, the battles are going to be hard. The player will be heavily punished by taking the wrong decisions. If you are losing a battle it will not be as easy as dropping a Phoenix feather or throwing a Potion to make a comeback. 

We took many elements from some AAA classic RPGs that everyone loves and improved most of the boring factors.

  • There will be no levels for all the party. But that doesn't mean the player cannot 'train' or 'grind'. The only character that will level up is David. The others will need to be synchronized with his level, using special points. That will allow certain level of customization to secondary characters skills. And since they are 'mind-controlled' by the main character, that means it creates a synergy between them.
  • You can combine weapons to make combos on the fly. Throw a grenade, use the shotgun or the assault rifle all in the same turn. As long as you have enough Battle Points to do it.
  • Speaking of which! There is no Mana Points or anything similar. There's a shared thing called 'Battle Points' that all characters in battle will use for skills and normal attacks. If you deal a good amount of damage, you will increase your party points by the end of the turn. On the other hand, if you are getting stomped by the enemy, you'll lose points.

Most of these systems are still being polished to be fully functional. Formulas need to be flawless!

Exploration

Full city to explore. You can find secrets and unlock around 50+ side-quests for items, house customization objects and characters to recruit. Find different shops, upgrade your weapons and play different mini-games. It's not an open world, but you can get access to new areas by progressing through the story.

Devious team is integrated by people who love both playing and making games. The members are from all across the Earth, from South America to United States and many more. We believe this mix can offer the best results.

More about our the team will be released with updates, so you can know about the members outside a simple description on this section. 


We want to keep working on the project no matter what. That's why we choose Flexible Funding. In the case we are not able to reach the proposed goal, the development of Devious will proceed -- at a lower rate, of course. It will take more time to be released, but eventually it WILL be released.

Although that's not really relevant.Raymond Clement (48): Former CDA agent, now missing and extremely dangerous. Joined the OUTLAW Project after losing his eye in a military operation as a Navy SEAL sniper. He's the main antagonist of Devious.Rebecca Templeton (29): Neuropsychiatrist assigned to David's command in order to tune the control technologies he employs.Kai Hale (27): Intelligence operator and coordinator assigned to David's command. She will help him through the missions giving important insight.Hans Nilsen (29): The young son of the Elkhound Security company. Hired by Raymond to recruit his mercenaries. He doesn't care about anything but money.Nika (25): Raymond's right hand and formidable assassin. Trained by Raymond after he saved her from a Russian prison. She's devoted to him and would follow every order. She blames the world for the torture she suffered which lead to her losing the left arm.Bertrand (Unknown): Mysterious looking man working for Raymond. His intentions are unknown, and he goes by the codename of 'Bertrand'. Nothing else is known about his past.Laureen (24): One of the controlled criminals deployed by David. Daughter of a politician, she used to be an arsonist. Cheerful and odd person, might get in troubles sometimes but definitely a reliable resource when it comes to combat.There are many more characters that will get announced every week through updates. Stay tuned for that!CombatWe want to focus in a dynamic gameplay. Usually, for most people, turn based combat RPGs translates to slow, press 'any button' to win or just 'grindfest'. So we try to work on a system complex enough to make the battles strategic but at the same time fast and reactive. First of all, the battles are going to be hard. The player will be heavily punished by taking the wrong decisions. If you are losing a battle it will not be as easy as dropping a Phoenix feather or throwing a Potion to make a comeback. We took many elements from some AAA classic RPGs that everyone loves and improved most of the boring factors.
There will be no levels for all the party. But that doesn't mean the player cannot 'train' or 'grind'. The only character that will level up is David. The others will need to be synchronized with his level, using special points. That will allow certain level of customization to secondary characters skills. And since they are 'mind-controlled' by the main character, that means it creates a synergy between them.
You can combine weapons to make combos on the fly. Throw a grenade, use the shotgun or the assault rifle all in the same turn. As long as you have enough Battle Points to do it.
Speaking of which! There is no Mana Points or anything similar. There's a shared thing called 'Battle Points' that all characters in battle will use for skills and normal attacks. If you deal a good amount of damage, you will increase your party points by the end of the turn. On the other hand, if you are getting stomped by the enemy, you'll lose points.
Most of these systems are still being polished to be fully functional. Formulas need to be flawless!ExplorationFull city to explore. You can find secrets and unlock around 50+ side-quests for items, house customization objects and characters to recruit. Find different shops, upgrade your weapons and play different mini-games. It's not an open world, but you can get access to new areas by progressing through the story.Devious team is integrated by people who love both playing and making games. The members are from all across the Earth, from South America to United States and many more. We believe this mix can offer the best results.More about our the team will be released with updates, so you can know about the members outside a simple description on this section. 

We want to keep working on the project no matter what. That's why we choose Flexible Funding. In the case we are not able to reach the proposed goal, the development of Devious will proceed -- at a lower rate, of course. It will take more time to be released, but eventually it WILL be released.

story:
The short version: This campaign is an effort to raise funds so The Stranger, a weekly newspaper in Seattle, can take our push for more government transparency to the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals. Neil Fox, the president of the local chapter of the National Lawyers' Guild, is working with us pro bono, but there are expenses—just filing an appeal costs $450, not to mention lots of printing, mailing, and other fees. We at The Stranger are able to chip in, but we can't afford the whole process on our own. So we're asking you for help.

The background: For several months, The Stranger has been following a story about people who received subpoenas to appear before a grand jury (sometimes those subpoenas were delivered early in the morning with kicked-down doors and flash grenades from police in SWAT gear). Those people were ostensibly summoned to answer questions about political vandalism in Seattle on May Day—but many of them weren’t in Seattle on May Day and say they were mostly questioned about other people's political opinions and social affiliations.

When they refused to answer such questions, they were thrown in prison for an indeterminate amount of time, without having been charged with (much less convicted of) a crime. Some of those people wound up spending months in solitary confinement. Their attorneys repeatedly asked why their clients were in solitary, but still have not received satisfactory answers from prison officials.

In the process of covering the story, The Stranger has been tangling with federal prosecutors over how much secrecy the feds should be allowed in court proceedings. From a paragraph in a recent news story:

"Throughout this process, The Stranger has been working with attorney Neil Fox, president of the local chapter of the National Lawyers Guild, petitioning to unseal some of the documents in this case that prosecutors have reflexively shielded. Some of those motions, for example, aren't sensitive to the investigation, but merely cite precedent and case law. We have been successful in getting some made public (such as a copy of the government's search-warrant affidavit, which [attorneys] Gordon and Kaplan say was helpful in getting their clients released), but not others (such as the full civil contempt proceedings). If we can raise the funds, Fox and The Stranger will push our case for greater government transparency to the US Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals. We plan to file soon."

After that story appeared, several readers approached us, saying they'd like to donate. If you're one of those people, or would like to help us in our push for greater government transparency, you've come to the right place.

We hope you'll join us in letting prosecutors know that we are interested in seeing how they do business in federal court.

story:
Short Summary

Demigod Crazh is the brainchild of Yunier Viada, a talented, traditional artist and friend. I on the other hand write software for a living and from time to time assist publishers like Apress with technical reviews on game development books. 

We decided to build a game with innovative fighting mechanics inspired by arcade hits and anime classics, i.e. Street Fighter, Saint Seiya, Sailor Moon, Dragon Ball Z, and many others.

While the genre is saturated with many similar games, the game-play mechanics in Demigod Crazh are unique in its design and delivery. This project never started with the goal of making money, or hitting it big. We want to complete a game we truly believe in and know fans of the genre will enjoy as well.

Please help us bring this game to life!

What We Need & What You Get

Between artwork, animation, and multi-platform support we don't have the necessary resources to complete the roster of 20 characters at its launch. How did we come up with $8000? We calculated the budget required to bring a third artist on board to help us finish the modeling, rigging, and animation of 12 remaining characters. The budget also includes the creation of better stages and texture retouches.

We hope you enjoy the following perks, and we are open to suggestions from our fellow gamers:

1.  $1 - Every dollar counts. At the risk of breaking the record for longest credit in a video game, we will display your name on a special thanks section.

2.  $5 - Aspiring game development package. Access granted to our development journal, game development, and training materials written for C# and MonoGame.

3.  $15 – Demigod Crazh! Pre-order. A copy of the game for Windows, iPad, Android, and Linux, as well as, early access to our beta release.

4.  $25 – Demigod Crazh! Special Edition. This includes secret game content, and two characters not part of the main roster.

5.  $50 – Demigod Crazh! Collectors Edition.  Prints of the games artwork signed by our game and character designer, Yunier Viada.

6.   $75 – The aspiring designer package. Receive developer tools so you can extend the game and add your own set of characters.

7.  $125 – Meet the team. Chat with us over Skype. Includes all previous perks.

8.  $300 –Be part of Demigod Crazh.  We will model a character after you or add a character following your specification. It must not commit copyright infringement.

What if we don't make it? If we don't make the $8000 goal, the game will still be completed with a smaller roster. We currently have 8 playable characters and are undergoing the process of opening our early access for 9/22/2014. With your support we can give it the polish it requires to be an excellent title for genre enthusiasts.

The Impact

With Demigod Crazh! we hope to expand the genre of fighting games, with the changes and mechanics that we, fans of the genre, always wanted to see in a game. Our objective is to create the fighting game that we always wanted to play. The term genre bender could be used, but we want the players to make that distinction. Making a game requires hard work and dedication. Lend us your support and we will finish it together.

Risks & Challenges

In any project there are risks and challenges we must face. For Demigod Clash, the biggest challenge is getting the game to run smoothly on different platforms. To achieve our multi-platform goal we are using the open source XNA implementation MonoGame (http://www.monogame.net/). We have faith in the reliability and underlying tools offered by MonoGame because of its proven track record with indie hits like Fez and Bastion.

At Apress I was the technical reviewer on 2D Game Development with C# and will be pulling my experience and the community's experience to overcome the challenges of having a successful multi-platform release.

Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Help us reach a wider audience by letting your friends know via the use of social media and word of mouth.


Q & A

1.  Why didn't you use Unity? Unity is a very powerful engine, but because our codebase had started with the now deprecated XNA Framework, it made more sense to go with MonoGame.

2.  What is the name of your Engine? MonoGame Mettle or Mettle for short. Mettle: a person's ability to cope well with difficulties or to face a demanding situation in a spirited and resilient way.

story:
The Origin Story

Street Team: Reign of the Iron Dragon tackles the story of five individual heroes joining together to overcome an unstoppable evil.  The fierce Kung Fu master; the brutal urban vigilante; the no-nonsense bounty hunter; the young street-wise champion; and the lethal defender of the city. Together, they must stop Oguun, the tyrannical despot who will stop at nothing to destroy all of their cities to lay claim to a coveted ultimate weapon.   

The Creators' Story

The Street Team concept began with five independent comic creators putting aside ego and banding together to produce several collaborative works. Initially starting with posters, sketches and a comic, the instant positive fan response sparked an idea: Why not create a videogame? It would establish the characters in a milestone most other comic book characters haven't achieved, even among much bigger companies. With an up and coming developer joining the team, six creators combined their skills for greatness.

A Goal for the Modern Age

Like the days of old, creators work from the ground up to build a dream. Combining their talents, both a crossover comic and an action packed game for the PC are being developed simultaneously.

Your Heroic Assist

While the game overall is coming together nicely, the size of the playable cast had to be scaled back in order to meet a June 2011 deadline for The Heroes Convention. With your help, we can add extra artists to the roster to facilitate smoothing out game design, spreading out the workload, creating more sprites, and speeding up the completion time. This in turn will allow us to present the game to distributors for release on larger platforms.

 

Your contributions allow you to be first in line for pre-ordering the complete game and the comic. You even have the potential to not only have your name listed in the game, but to actually be in the game.

Signal in the Sky

Spread the word!  There's no better way to see something succeed than getting others involved. Keep an eye on this space and we'll keep you updated with fresh screen-shots and demos.

story:
Version française ici!

 

 

Who we are ?

I was introduced to card games at 10 years old. Since, I played almost of all wellknow card games. I also have a passion for  classics board games like monopoly, Clue, Payday etc. I've got into role playing games at the age of 17. (Dongeon and dragon second edition, Forgotten Realms). I evolved with a little RPG players community in my home town. We all got very passionate by new board games at the same period of time. Agricola, Small World and Catan are ones of those we got to play all time.  I studied in programmer\analyst course and I also hold a degree as technical support.

With friends, all skilled in coding and creating graphics, we developed a card games platform called Adecke. Our Studio Adecke.inc company has been created 8 months later. In all over a years work. We have completed the first part of our project : the platform. Now is the time to develop games for the plateform and add extra content. 

Why do we need crowdfunding ?

We are keepin on investing thousands of free work hour's time. Investing also thousand of dollars comming from our own pockets to get the platform online and working sharp. To us, defining the needs of our customers is a must. Our project was several times submitted to many gouvernment programs, but sadly responces were more or less likely the same. According to them, the project does not match with the appliance planning.  They beleive that we must generate sales before getting any support from them.  

The Adecke's platform's phylosophy is to provide material to satisfy the mature, good and all kind of gamer. Let us know we are right. Help us to define the Adecke's project

Direct impact

  • Offers great opportunity to play card games at a low price.
  • The assurance of getting 8 games and several tournaments working.
  • Serving a larger community of players.
  • Chance of getting alot more content at the launch date.
  • Helping the community creating challenging and rewarding jobs.

What will we do with the money ?

Money will be invested by the Adecke team to complete a maximum of development and buy advertising. Access of the Adecke platform will be free until the team can't develop more content and buy decent adversiting with funded money.

 

 So what's Adecke ? A card games network ?

Adecke is a gaming platform that will offert a quality place to play cards games at low cost. It include 8 cards games. Each games will be playable on 9 differents way. 

 Adecke also include content as :

  • coins
  • player's specializations
  • ladders
  • guilds
  • guilds ladders
  • guild events
  • trophy
  • more...

Players will be able to buy with virtual coins :

  • avatars
  • tables
  • floors
  • emoticons
  • cards decks

The cost to access to Adecke ? Any gambling ?

Adecke is base on subcription fees, you will have access to all the content for a small amount of money per month. There will be no gambling or casino style activities. We will support virtual coins to create challenge for some mod but nothing will let you gain money. Only games with the right purpose... Having fun and mind challenge and good times.

Alot of artworks ?

Adecke got a special place for artists. Many artists will be approach to participate to the customization of the platform and games elements. Artist will be known by Adecke's players around the world.

Adecke is base on secure and portable tool.  For HD and standard display, with Java and JavaFX, the adecke softwaret is compatible with Windows, Mac and Linux. After the release of Java 8, Adecke will be available for ios and android.

                            

After one year's work , with our small but reliable team,  we got the platform working good, There is one game playable in solo (bots) and multiplayer mode, many functions are now available. A basic set of graphics from our talented graphisst is ready to be use.

  • An easy to use interface. Only five minute is needed to get in control of it.  
  • The game room is designed to replicate a table game sensation. 
  • A online boutique will provide many things to buy related to card games. 
  • The events section on the website will accessible to every cards clubs, associations, or organizations. It will show events that will come in your region.

 

Why should you contribute to complete the Adecke platform ?

Classic card games have been played for over 400 years. They are still popular in most of North America and European countries. They are strong, and have been approved by almost all of us at a certain period of time. We want to make them come back on the internet and improving the card games experiences with different mods. Creating events that everyone will remember.  Being capable to play with friends, teams, by using your own skills to help them win the dual. Gather points and participate to a fight on the war field. Challenge the best players. Survive to whoever want's to see you loose. Play and drink with friends over internet. Play classic ways by respecting officials rules and conventions.

We are here to offer you our knowledge and create the most famous and sharpest card game collection playable on the internet of all time. 

Gameroom

(Bull Card Game)

 

 (The bull game is a card game with a average level of difficulty between the Whist and Bridge. )

Will this project ever be completed  ?

Let's be real, nothing can garanty a crowdfunded project. One thing is for sure, we don't want to waste one year's work. Adecke's Team are the ones who most want to see the Studio Adecke.inc become reality. We sacrificed to complete the first part of the project. The plateform success is now our main priority. 

 Website

  1. Join our website at www.adecke.com.
  2. Create yourseft a account
  3. Run the client from the play button.

(Need the latest version of Java)

Dev note :

  • We are now working on bots and debugging multiple tables.
  • It's not the final version of the Bull game and bugs still remain in the game.
  • Chrome launch is buggy.
  • Test scripts for bots, will be replaced soon.
  • The client from the download section is deprecated. (Must run from the play button)

Listing of Specifications

  • Support any Standard and HD resolution
  • Combatible Windows, MacOSX, Linux
  • 1 to 4 per game
  • 16 to 1024 players per events.
  • Made with Java and Java FX.
  • Çan be run from a .exe or from Java web start.
  • Client is less than 100 meg
  • Customizable
  • Virtual Shop
  • Online Boutique
  • Secure

 

 

 

 

 

Version française

  

Après 2 ans de travail, aidez-nous à compléter notre plate-forme de jeux... 8 jeux et 9 modes de jeux. Personnalisation, statistiques, échelles de joueurs, trophées, défis.

Qui somme-nous?

J'ai été initié au jeux de cartes à l'âge de 10 ans. À ce jour, j'ai joué à la majorité des jeux de cartes populaires. J'ai aussi développé une passion pour les jeux de société comme Monopoly, Clue, Jour de paye etc. J'ai fait mes débuts dans les jeux de rôles sur table à l'âge de 17 ans. (Donjons et dragons 2ième édition, Les royaumes oubliés.) Je me suis impliqué à plusieurs activités reliées aux jeux de rôles dans une communauté dans ma région. Moi et mes amis sommes tous devenus accros aux nouveaux jeux de société, en même temps. Agricola, Small World, Colon de Catan sont les jeux les plus joués dans nos soirées entre amis. J'ai étudié comme programmeur analyste et j'ai complété un cours de soutien informatique.

Avec des amis, programmeurs et graphistes, nous avons développé une plate-forme de jeux de cartes qui se nomme Adecke. Nous avons créé la compagnie Studio Adecke.inc huit mois passés. Après un an de préparation et un an de production, nous avons réalisé la moitié notre projet : la plate-forme. Afin de finir notre projet, nous devons développer les jeux de cartes prévus et du contenu supplémentaire.

Pourquoi nous voulons nous financer par la foule? (Crowdfunding)

Nous investissons des milliers d'heures de travail sans rémunération. Nous avons investi aussi des milliers de dollars afin que la plate-forme soit opérationnelle et qu'elle fonctionne bien. Pour nous, définir les besoins des joueurs de jeux de cartes en ligne est une priorité.  Notre projet a été soumis à plusieurs programmes gouvernementaux et organismes, mais sans aucun succès.

La philosophie derrière la plate-forme Adecke est de fournir un bon contenu, mature, et pour tous les types de joueurs. Laissez-nous savoir que nous travaillons dans le bon sens. Aidez-nous à finaliser Adecke. 

Conséquences directes :

  • Offre une bonne opportunité de jouer aux jeux de cartes à bas prix.
  • Une assurance d'avoir au minimum 8 jeux de cartes et différents tournois fonctionnels.
  • Desservir une grande communauté de joueurs
  • Avoir plus de contenu au lancement de Adecke
  • Aider notre communauté avec la création d'emplois gratifiant et rempli de défi.

Qu'est ce que nous allons faire avec l'argent?

L'argent va être investi par l'équipe Adecke afin de compléter un maximum de contenu et acheter de la publicité au lancement de la plate-forme.  La plate-forme Adecke reste accessible gratuitement durant la période de développement. Elle deviendra payante seulement au lancement.

Qu'est ce que Adecke?

Adecke c'est une plate-forme de jeux qui offre une place de qualité pour jouer au cartes sur internet.  À prix modique, vous pourrez jouer à 8 jeux avec 9 différentes façons à chacuns des jeux.

 Adecke contient également :

  • Crédits
  • Système de spécialisation des joueurs
  • Création de groupe de joueurs
  • Échelles de joueurs et groupes
  • Événements de groupes
  • Trophées
  • et plus encore...

 Les joueurs seront capable d'acheter avec l'argent virtuel (Crédits) :

  • Avatars de profil
  • Tables de jeux
  • Plancher de chambre de jeux
  • Émoticônes
  • Paquets de jeux de cartes

Le coût pour jouer sur Adecke? Est-ce un site de loto?

Adecke est accessible avec des frais d'abonnement. Vous aurez accès à tout le contenu pour un coût d'abonnement très bas.  Aucune loterie ou activités de type casino sera disponible sur Adecke. L'argent virtuel est seulement utilisé afin de créer du défi pour certains modes de jeux. Il n'y aura aucune façon de gagner de l'argent. Les jeux seront disponibles pour les bonne raisons... avoir du plaisir, relever un défi intellectuel, et passer du bon temps.

Il y aura beaucoup d'éléments graphiques? (Personnalisations)

 Adecke confer une place spéciale pour les artistes. Plusieurs artistes seront approchés afin de participer à la personnalisation de la plate-forme ainsi qu'à la création des éléments de jeux. Les artistes obtiendrons une bonne visibilité auprès des joueurs d'Adecke et de sa communauté.

Adecke est construit avec des outils sécuritaires et portables. Le logiciel supporte les définitions d'écrans standard et haute-définition. Adecke est compatible avec les systèmes d'exploitation Windows, Mac et Linux. Après la sortie de Java 8 (Incluant JavaFX) Adecke fonctionnera sous les téléphones intelligents et tablettes  iOS et Android.

 

Après une année de travail avec notre équipe, nous avons une plate-forme de jeux. Un jeu est disponible en mode solo (robots) et en mode mufti-joueurs. Plusieurs fonctionnalités sont disponibles actuellement. Un ensemble graphiques est aussi disponible grâce à notre talentueux graphiste et prêt à être utilisés.

  • Un interface facile à utiliser. Seulement 5 minutes d’accommodation est requis afin d'avoir le plein contrôle de celui ci.
  • Les chambres de jeux recréent la sensation d'une partie de jeux de cartes sur tables.
  • Une boutique en ligne sera disponible afin d'acheter des objet divers.
  • Une section d’événements est mis à la disposition des clubs et associations de jeux de cartes pour qu'ils puissent afficher les événements de leur organisation.

Pourquoi vous devez contribuer à la finalisation de la plate-forme ?

Les jeux de cartes sont joués depuis plus de 400 ans. Ils sont encore populaires dans la majeure partie des pays Nord Américains et Européen. Ils sont éprouvés et approuvé par chacuns de nous à un certain âge. Nous désirons faire revivre ces jeux sur internet et améliorer l'expérience avec différente façon de jouer. La création d’événements que tous se souviendrons. Être capable de jouer avec des amis et équipes de joueurs en utilisant vos compétences pour faire gagner votre équipe. Amasser des points dans une partie de jeux pour supporter votre équipe dans un grand duel. Défier les meilleurs joueurs de la communauté. Survivre à tous ceux qui veux vous voir perdre. Jouer au jeux de la beuverie avec vos amis sur internet. Jouer de façon classique dans le respect des règles officielles et différentes conventions.

Nous sommes ici pour offrir nos compétence afin de créer la plus ambitieuse et incroyable collection de jeux de cartes jouable sur internet de tous les temps. 

Chambre de jeu

 

(Le niveau de difficulté du jeu de Boeuf se situe entre celui du Whist (9) et du Bridge.)

Est-ce que le projet sera complété?

Soyons réalistes, rien ne garantie la réalisation complète d'un projet qui se finance par la foule. Une chose est sûre, nous ne désirons pas perdre un an de travail. Les membres de notre équipe sont ceux qui désirent le plus voir le projet se réaliser et que Studio Adecke.inc deviens réalité. Nous avons sacrifié beaucoup pour la première partie du projet. Le succès de la plate-forme est notre priorité. 

Site Web 

  1. Joindre notre site web au : www.adecke.com
  2. Créez-vous un compte
  3. Démarrez le jeu depuis le bouton « Jouer »

(Vous devez avoir Java )

Notes de développement

  • Nous sommes en train de travailler sur les robots (Boeuf) et la correction d'erreurs.
  • Le jeu de bœuf n'est pas en version finale et quelques erreurs subsistent.
  • Le lanceur ne fonctionne pas avec Chrome. (Erreur)
  • Un script de test pour robots du jeux de Boeuf est utilisé présentement.
  • Le jeu téléchargeable depuis la section « Téléchargement » n'est pas à jour. (Vous devez lancer le jeu depuis le bouton « Jouer »

 Liste des spécifications de la plate-forme

  • L'affichage standard et haute définition est supporté
  • Compatible Windows, Mac, et Linux
  • 1 à 4 joueurs par partie
  • 16 à 1024 joueurs par événements
  • Fait avec Java et JavaFX
  • Le logiciel peut être lancé depuis un exécutable ou « Java Web Start »
  • Le logiciel ne dépasse pas 100 mo
  • Personnalisable.
  • Boutique en ligne.
  • Sécuritaire

story_txt:
Version française ici!
 

 
Who we are ?
I was introduced to card games at 10 years old. Since, I played almost of all wellknow card games. I also have a passion for  classics board games like monopoly, Clue, Payday etc. I've got into role playing games at the age of 17. (Dongeon and dragon second edition, Forgotten Realms). I evolved with a little RPG players community in my home town. We all got very passionate by new board games at the same period of time. Agricola, Small World and Catan are ones of those we got to play all time.  I studied in programmer\analyst course and I also hold a degree as technical support.
 With friends, all skilled in coding and creating graphics, we developed a card games platform called Adecke. Our Studio Adecke.inc company has been created 8 months later. In all over a years work. We have completed the first part of our project : the platform. Now is the time to develop games for the plateform and add extra content.  
Why do we need crowdfunding ?
We are keepin on investing thousands of free work hour's time. Investing also thousand of dollars comming from our own pockets to get the platform online and working sharp. To us, defining the needs of our customers is a must. Our project was several times submitted to many gouvernment programs, but sadly responces were more or less likely the same. According to them, the project does not match with the appliance planning.  They beleive that we must generate sales before getting any support from them.   
The Adecke's platform's phylosophy is to provide material to satisfy the mature, good and all kind of gamer. Let us know we are right. Help us to define the Adecke's project
Direct impact

Offers great opportunity to play card games at a low price.
The assurance of getting 8 games and several tournaments working.
Serving a larger community of players.
Chance of getting alot more content at the launch date.
Helping the community creating challenging and rewarding jobs.
What will we do with the money ?
Money will be invested by the Adecke team to complete a maximum of development and buy advertising. Access of the Adecke platform will be free until the team can't develop more content and buy decent adversiting with funded money.
 
 So what's Adecke ? A card games network ?
Adecke is a gaming platform that will offert a quality place to play cards games at low cost. It include 8 cards games. Each games will be playable on 9 differents way.  

 Adecke also include content as :

 coins
player's specializations
 ladders
 guilds
 guilds ladders
 guild events
 trophy
more...
Players will be able to buy with virtual coins :

avatars
 tables
floors
 emoticons
 cards decks 
The cost to access to Adecke ? Any gambling ?
Adecke is base on subcription fees, you will have access to all the content for a small amount of money per month. There will be no gambling or casino style activities. We will support virtual coins to create challenge for some mod but nothing will let you gain money. Only games with the right purpose... Having fun and mind challenge and good times.
Alot of artworks ?
Adecke got a special place for artists. Many artists will be approach to participate to the customization of the platform and games elements. Artist will be known by Adecke's players around the world. 
Adecke is base on secure and portable tool.  For HD and standard display, with Java and JavaFX, the adecke softwaret is compatible with Windows, Mac and Linux. After the release of Java 8, Adecke will be available for ios and android.
                            
After one year's work , with our small but reliable team,  we got the platform working good, There is one game playable in solo (bots) and multiplayer mode, many functions are now available. A basic set of graphics from our talented graphisst is ready to be use. 



An easy to use interface. Only five minute is needed to get in control of it.  

The game room is designed to replicate a table game sensation. 

A online boutique will provide many things to buy related to card games. 
The events section on the website will accessible to every cards clubs, associations, or organizations. It will show events that will come in your region.
 
Why should you contribute to complete the Adecke platform ?
Classic card games have been played for over 400 years. They are still popular in most of North America and European countries. They are strong, and have been approved by almost all of us at a certain period of time. We want to make them come back on the internet and improving the card games experiences with different mods. Creating events that everyone will remember.  Being capable to play with friends, teams, by using your own skills to help them win the dual. Gather points and participate to a fight on the war field. Challenge the best players. Survive to whoever want's to see you loose. Play and drink with friends over internet. Play classic ways by respecting officials rules and conventions.
We are here to offer you our knowledge and create the most famous and sharpest card game collection playable on the internet of all time. 

Gameroom
(Bull Card Game)

 
 (The bull game is a card game with a average level of difficulty between the Whist and Bridge. )
Will this project ever be completed  ?
Let's be real, nothing can garanty a crowdfunded project. One thing is for sure, we don't want to waste one year's work. Adecke's Team are the ones who most want to see the Studio Adecke.inc become reality. We sacrificed to complete the first part of the project. The plateform success is now our main priority. 

 Website

Join our website at www.adecke.com.
Create yourseft a account
Run the client from the play button.
(Need the latest version of Java)
Dev note :

We are now working on bots and debugging multiple tables.
It's not the final version of the Bull game and bugs still remain in the game.
Chrome launch is buggy.
Test scripts for bots, will be replaced soon.
The client from the download section is deprecated. (Must run from the play button)
Listing of Specifications

Support any Standard and HD resolution
Combatible Windows, MacOSX, Linux
1 to 4 per game
16 to 1024 players per events.
Made with Java and Java FX.
Çan be run from a .exe or from Java web start.
Client is less than 100 meg
Customizable
Virtual Shop
Online Boutique
Secure

Qui somme-nous?
J'ai été initié au jeux de cartes à l'âge de 10 ans. À ce jour, j'ai joué à la majorité des jeux de cartes populaires. J'ai aussi développé une passion pour les jeux de société comme Monopoly, Clue, Jour de paye etc. J'ai fait mes débuts dans les jeux de rôles sur table à l'âge de 17 ans. (Donjons et dragons 2ième édition, Les royaumes oubliés.) Je me suis impliqué à plusieurs activités reliées aux jeux de rôles dans une communauté dans ma région. Moi et mes amis sommes tous devenus accros aux nouveaux jeux de société, en même temps. Agricola, Small World, Colon de Catan sont les jeux les plus joués dans nos soirées entre amis. J'ai étudié comme programmeur analyste et j'ai complété un cours de soutien informatique.
Avec des amis, programmeurs et graphistes, nous avons développé une plate-forme de jeux de cartes qui se nomme Adecke. Nous avons créé la compagnie Studio Adecke.inc huit mois passés. Après un an de préparation et un an de production, nous avons réalisé la moitié notre projet : la plate-forme. Afin de finir notre projet, nous devons développer les jeux de cartes prévus et du contenu supplémentaire.
Pourquoi nous voulons nous financer par la foule? (Crowdfunding)
Nous investissons des milliers d'heures de travail sans rémunération. Nous avons investi aussi des milliers de dollars afin que la plate-forme soit opérationnelle et qu'elle fonctionne bien. Pour nous, définir les besoins des joueurs de jeux de cartes en ligne est une priorité.  Notre projet a été soumis à plusieurs programmes gouvernementaux et organismes, mais sans aucun succès.
La philosophie derrière la plate-forme Adecke est de fournir un bon contenu, mature, et pour tous les types de joueurs. Laissez-nous savoir que nous travaillons dans le bon sens. Aidez-nous à finaliser Adecke.

story:
What inspires us

A teetotum (TTOTUM) is a spinning top that is known across Europe from Roman times. It has a polygonal body - originally four-sided - marked with letters or numbers, which indicate the result of each spin. The name originates from Latin Totum meaning 'all' which was marked by a T on one of the four sides and indicated that the winning player could take all the played tokens. More on Wiki >>>

We decide to bring this very first game to these days. 











Q. What surface is the best for TTOTUM spinner?
A. TTOTUM spinner can be placed on all flat, horizontal and solid surfaces. Surface must be clean and dry.

Q. What kind of material is spinner made from?
A. Stainless steel or real bronze.

Q. How the phone holds on the top of spinner?
A. Special sticky pads are designed to hold the phone on the top of spinner and the spinner on the surface. These sticky pads are washable and can be used multiple times.

Q. How strong does the phone hold on the top of the spinner?
A. Strong enough to spin safely and for detaching after game.

Q. Can these sticky pads scratch my phone?
A. No.

Q. What phones are suitable to play TTOTUM games?
A. Any smartphone with iOS v. 7.0 (or higher) or Android v 4.4 (or higher).

Q. How many game cards are on TTOTUM games?
A. You will find thousands of games cards with the actions to do or questions to answer since day one and new will be continually added.

Q. Why physical spinner is used instead of creating mobile app with rotation function?
A. The answer is the same as: why people go to theatre instead of cinema and why do they watch sports in arena instead on TV, etc.

Q. Where will I be able to download TTOTUM games apps?
A. You will be able to download apps from Apple store, Google play store or official TTOTUM website.

Q. Will I an have opportunity to offer my action or question to add to game?
A. Yes, all TTOTUM funders will have a unique opportunity to be a part of game creators and offer questions and actions. TTOTUM facebook page is designed for that.

Q. What will the TTOTUM retail price be?
A. The products available now will not be available elsewhere other than Indiegogo . Also bear in mind that its only during this campaign you can get the bronze spinner and lifetime free games apps.

Q. When will TOTUM be available in retail?
A. From May 2016. Funders will get their TTOTUMs in April 2016.

Q. How often will you communicate project status updates to funders?
A. Status update report will be released at least once a month.

Q. How will I be able to provide additional information like what color case I choose or the name to engrave on the top of bronze spinner or inform about change of delivery address?
A. After Indiegogo campaign we will email you a special questionnaire to collect all needed information regarding product you choose and delivery.

Q. Do you have a referral program?

A. Yes, please find more information bellow. 

How to participate in a referral contest, please find here >>>

and the spinner on the surface. These sticky pads are washable and can be used multiple times.  

Q. How strong does the phone hold on the top of the spinner? 
A. Strong enough to spin safely and for detaching after game.

Q. Can these sticky pads scratch my phone?
A. No.

Q. What phones are suitable to play TTOTUM games?
A. Any smartphone with iOS v. 7.0 (or higher) or Android v 4.4 (or higher).

Q. How many game cards are on TTOTUM games?
A. You will find thousands of games cards with the actions to do or
questions to answer since day one and new will be continually
added.

Q. Why physical spinner is used instead of creating mobile app with rotation
function?
A. The answer is the same as: why people go to theatre instead of cinema and why do they watch sports in arena instead on TV, etc.

Q. Where will I be able to download TTOTUM games apps?
A. You will be able to download apps from Apple store, Google play store or
official TTOTUM website.

Q. Will I an have opportunity to offer my action or question to add to game?
A. Yes, all TTOTUM funders will have a unique opportunity to be a part of game
creators and offer questions and actions. TTOTUM facebook page is designed for
that.
Q. What will the TTOTUM retail price be?
A. The products available now will not be available elsewhere other than Indiegogo . Also bear in mind that its only during this campaign you can get the bronze spinner and lifetime free games apps.
Q. When will TOTUM be available in retail?
A. From May 2016. Funders will get their TTOTUMs in April 2016. 
Q. How often will you communicate project status updates to funders?
A. Status update report will be released at least once a month.
Q. How will I be able to provide additional information like what color case I choose or the name to engrave on the top of bronze spinner or inform about change of delivery address?
A. After Indiegogo campaign we will email you a special questionnaire to
collect all needed information regarding product you choose and delivery.
Q. Do you have a referral program?
A. Yes, please find more information bellow. 



How to participate in a referral contest, please find here >>>

The Audio Version of the description and perks:
