story:
Click aquí para ver la pagina en castellano

Welcome to the ancient port of Whitescar, trading hub of the Euredese Sea and the most rank, noisy, wealthy, diverse and dangerous citadel in the known world.  Pull up a seat in The Focsle - one of our better inns - and take a well-earned break from the thieves, smugglers and traders who cram our streets in the summer months.  Have a cooling tankard of Envent beer and put your feet up.  If you're lucky we'll show you how to play our game, the game we Whitescarians have been playing and adapting over the many generations since its creator - and the founder of our city -  met his Gods.  Have you heard of Jaraph's Table?

 Perhaps you're from one of those far-flung western lands, like Kolan or Arco, and haven't heard of Jaraph Longpin either, although you should've.  Jaraph was the head of a Korrentse tribe called the Biornwald, some four-and-a-half centuries ago.  The Korrentse were a warlike race - still are - and were pirates and bandits by nature.  Betrayed and attacked by those he thought his allies, Jaraph Longpin fought against overwhelming odds and a terrible Korrentse winter and still managed to escape, taking what remained of his tribe across the Western Sea. 

The passage was hard - they had to fight campaigns across the wildernesses of Garacraig and The Land of the Dead before settling among the people of Hern, who were fighting a bitter war (the Euredese War, which raged for three generations)  against the island of Merca.  Here Jaraph's leadership, combined with the seafaring skill and martial prowess of his Korrentse warriors, soon swung the tide of the war.  As a reward for his considerable services to Hern, Jaraph was awarded this island.  Back then it was bare rock, just look at it now.

 Anyway, the point was - old Jaraph.  Once he'd settled here and all the war and strife was over his warlike mind still craved challenges (beyond the demands made by governance and taxation).  Now advancing in years, he took to what the Korrentse people simply called the Table to keep his faculties honed.  (I think most countries have their own version of the Korrentse Table:  the eastern isles have a games of nobles and warriors played upon a wooden board and west of the Euredese Sea people play their own similar games using coloured beads)

 Drawing upon his own campaign experience, Jaraph developed the rules of the Table until he felt it properly reflected the real demands of the battlefield.  Added were more playing pieces, all with specific strengths, weaknesses and abilities, the element of chance (dice were used to resolve attacks) and the strategic importance of terrain - represented by penalties and bonuses for height, rough ground or defensive structures.  Jaraph's Table has been played here in Whitescar for some four hundred years now.  Think you're up to the challenge?

New Moon Games are developing Jaraph's Table for PC, Mac and ultimately iOS and Android.  As with other games we've developed independently in the past, we're making Jaraph's Table because it's something we want to play ourselves - a game with a nod towards the old-school turn-based games of the past but with a sizeable dollop of current-gen polish (plus some cool new takes on the traditional strategy genre).  Built in Flash Develop and utilising the powerful Starling framework, Jaraph's Table showcases a fusion of beautifully crafted 3d art and traditional 2d animation which combines to create a unique take on the traditional hex-based TBS.  Play through Jaraph's early campaigns in single-player mode, grab a quickbattle against AI, or challenge you friends and foes to asynchronous multiplayer combat.

    *CHECK THE UPDATES AND GALLERY SECTION FOR GAMEPLAY VIDS*

 

FEATURES:

Single player - As well as a quick-play section featuring the main game modes, the full game will contain a number of single player campaigns, each containing a series of levels of increasing difficulty. You begin with the short tutorial campaign, which introduces the standard unit types and tactics, before moving on to bigger challenges, such as Jaraph's early battles.

Multiplayer - Challenge your friends to a game online and because of Jaraph’s Table's turn-based nature you can either play your battle in one intensive session or sneak your turns while you’re supposed to be working and spread the fight out over the working week.

Heroes - Every now and then a unit will go to hell and back on the battlefield, and it's only fair that this should be recognised:  a piece which consistently goes above and beyond the call of duty may acquire Hero status.  Heroes become unique pieces, with their own names and statistics.  Through each single and multiplayer game, victorious Hero units will acquire experience and perks. Level up your Heroes in the single player campaign and then take them online to battle those of your friends (or enemies, why limit yourself).
Expand your tactical options by unlocking new Hero units and rare unit types by completing campaigns and online challenges.

Battle Canvas - Rather than resolve combat (rather dryly) on the board itself, all the action in JT takes place on the 'Battle Canvas', which drops down over the board when a piece is attacked.  The resulting combat is played out in visceral, cinematic shadowplay-meets-magic lantern battles - created dynamically and guaranteed to be different every time.

Build your own - We're building a user-friendly level editor alongside the game, so after the initial game release we'll be following up with an expansion pack which gives access to the level editor and an online community built around user-generated content. Create your own levels and even entire campaigns and share them with your friends or the whole JT community.

New content packs - In addition to the core game there are several DLC packs planned, including the oriental expansion - which brings new unit designs, a new board and environment and new solo campaigns.  Later packs will include new unit types, campaigns and battle modes.

You can take it with you - The first release of Jaraph's Table is going to be for PC and Mac. If we exceed our target for funding we'll be porting the game to iOS, Android and potentially Ouya.  The same user information will be accessible across all devices, so if you start a multiplayer game at your workstation you can continue the battle on your iPad or iPhone while you’re on the train, or even on your console when you get home.

 

 

UNIT TYPES:

We have lots of additions planned for later, but here are the pieces you will be able to use in the first version of Jaraph's Table:

Warrior - Standard melee piece, fast moving and light.  The 'pawn' of JT.

Champion - Heavy infantry type, slow moving but powerful.  Think of it as the 'tank' or 'phalanx' of the game.

Spy - The espionage/assassin piece, it remains invisible to the enemy unless discovered by another spy or otherwise rumbled through error.  With the potential to destroy structures and assassinate powerful units, spies can wreak havoc on the board if no counter-espionage units are fielded by the opposing side.

Archer - The only playing piece capable of ranged combat, the archer is fast, light and ideal for border skirmish actions.

Engineer - Capable of raising/lowering terrain, draining/flooding tiles and building/repairing resource-gathering structures (farm, woodcutter, mine) as well as defensive towers, engineers can be used to mould the board to your advantage.  The only piece which can traverse water tiles, they are key to a well-balanced strategy, and being very lightly armed should be well guarded.

Herald - The messenger, or 'comms' piece.  Keep Heralds close to your combat troops for an action point boost.

King - The most important piece on the board, the King permanently boosts his side's action points and, in Regicide mode, is core to success:  lose him and lose the battle.  The King is a powerful unit but commit him wisely - even in future game modes his loss involves hefty action point penalties.

 

 



New Moon Games is an independent studio comprised of 4 developers (including 4 artists, 2 animators, 2 designers and 1.5 programmers, so much more than a sum of its parts) based in the historic city of York, England.  As a company we've been together for two years but the core team has collaborated on numerous multi-platform projects over the last eight years or so.

We are:

Alex is our Creative/Art Director, Game Designer, senior 3d bod, the brains behind Jaraph’s Table and master of BBQs.  During his ten year servitude in the mainstream games industry he worked on titles such as Burnout Revenge, Black, Need for Speed Shift and Need for Speed Shift Unleashed - plus some other's he'd rather forget.

Andy is our Lead Programmer, Managing Director, fledgling cheese-maker and resident inadvertent stunt motorcyclist.  As comfortable with an art package as an algorithm, Andy served his time in web and educational gaming before going, lone wolf style, into the world of independent game development in the noughties.  His can-do attitude almost counts as a fifth member of the team in itself - if Andy can't get it working, it just isn't going to work, period.

Emma is our Lead Artist, bargain-hunting Ninja, zombie expert and our only proper, bona fide, graduate artist.   Emma is our photo-real texture expert and is responsible for the look and feel of most of the architecture and environments within Jaraph's Table.  She has Burnout Revenge, Black and Need for Speed Shift 1 in her portfolio.


Mike is our Concept Artist, Lead Animator, pacifist, cage fighter and teller of tall (albeit factually correct) stories.  He is also our most fanatic gamer, with a gamerscore in excess of 72k (He wanted that to be known!) and the uncanny (and infuriating) ability to put a virtual bullet in your head from any angle or distance.  Although a comparative newcomer to the industry, Mike has worked on projects for clients such as Pirelli, WKD, Fruit of the Loom and various internal projects that we could tell you about but Mike would have to kill you. Politely.

 

Our Aim:

New Moon Games has existed for two years, during which time we've developed a lot of apps, games, cool flash and html5 sites, augmented reality demos etc - but always for someone else (and as we're subcontracted, we go uncredited).  While this pays the bills, it naturally means our own projects have taken a back seat, leaving us treading water in creative terms (especially painful as we have a few games designed and ready for pre-pro and a folder bursting with other game concepts). 

In January 2012 we decided to remedy this and push through one of our projects to completion.  Jaraph's Table - a concept which we'd kicked around a few years ago with a sci-fi theme - came out the winner.  Since then we've worked in our own time to get JT to Alpha.  If we can meet our funding targtet, we can get a stompingly good turn-based strategy game out in the Spring of 2013. 

 


Jaraph's Table is at the pre-Alpha/Alpha nebulous border.  Everyone who contributes towards pushing it over this border gets as a bare minimum:  early access to Beta (including forum for feedback and suggestions), the full game on release, plus the Oriental DLC pack (Oriental pieces and troops, playing board, themed environment, custom urban tiles etc), which is already well into development so will follow hard on the heels of initial release.  We're currently planning on releasing Jaraph's Table with the Regicide - Kill the enemy King - game mode, full multiplayer functionality and quick battle and campaign modes in single player.  The singleplayer campaign will be iterated and expanded on in a series of free updates over time.  Both the game and future expansions will be digital download only.

Alternative game modes, different armies, a level editor so you can build your own battlefields and then challenge all comers, hero progression and toggleable game variables such as weather conditions, disease and natural disasters are among the updates planned. We are all avid gamers and want to make Jaraph's Table as good as it possibly can be.

In addition to the enormous Karma of knowing you've assisted indie game development, as a contributor you not only help make these things happen sooner, you get access to them ASAP - and if you beta-test get the chance to tell us directly what you think.  Larger contributors also get the opportunity to become part of the game by having characters named after them, a listing in the credits, design their own army and even - God help them - meet the dev team!*

As none of us want to give up the creative control of our work which being beholden to a large investor or publisher entails, we decided right from the start that New Moon Games would always be an Indie studio.  We have gone with what we consider to be the most honest route by choosing a flexible funding campaign, as we will continue to work on Jaraph's Table in our own time if we have to.  Without your assistance, Jaraph's Table will be released late next year, but your pledges (which will effectively keep us fed, watered, housed and in office space while we work) will help us get there much, much sooner - if we can meet our target that should be the first quarter 2013. 

 

 

*Note that Hero names and Piece designs are subject to negotiation and developers' discretion.  Delivery dates for the game and subsequent expansions will rely on how much we are able to raise - Beta is scheduled for the New Year. How things progress with funding and uptake will also dictate what form the launch party takes;  it'll never be like something Sony would lay on, but regardless it will definitely involve copious amounts of good food, booze and nerdiness :)

story:
Short Summary

We are a small company called Level Games, we have experience with game engines, and are passionate about making games. It costs a lot to develop and publish a game and that is why we need you!

  • We live in the North of England which is an area where a lot of game development is done.
  • We would love to be able to fund the entire game production ourselves, but it is a very costly business.
  • Your money goes towards the Game Engine, and extra tools and publishing methods, that will help the game get to you.

Our game is fantastic at the stage it is at! But to make it even better, and provide the best experience for the consumers, we need financial help to get it off the ground.

What We Need & What You Get

Here is what you get for helping us:

  • We need around £5000 to get this game ready to sell. This money will go towards a fantastic game engine, and several other tools to add components to the game. Other things like publishing methods will be paid for with this money.
  • We have some fantastic perks up for grabs!
  • £5 Donator Perk- a Level Games Desktop Wallpaper, and a place in the Special Thanks To section of the credits!
  • £20 T Shirt Perk- you get a Level Games T Shirt! Just tell us your size. (Includes all previous perks)
  • £100 CO-PRODUCER Perk- you are the CO-PRODUCER! Get exclusive previews of the game in development, plus be mentioned as the CO-PRODUCER in the game credits.
  • Even if we don't reach our goal, don't worry! The game will still be released and you will still receive your perks, but the game's release might be slightly delayed.

The Game

All proceeds go towards developing and publishing our first game. Most of the details are still confidential, but here are some things that the game will feature:

  • A first person style, unique against all other games.
  • Great graphics, built on a great engine.
  • Huge open world(s) for you to explore, fantastic visuals that make the experience special.
  • The option to do whatever you want! Don't feel like you have to do anything, explore, discover and enjoy!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, that's fine! Here are some of the other ways you can help:

  • Tell other people about the Campaign, the more the merrier!
  • Share the link on Facebook (and other sites), and don't forget to use the Indiegogo sharing tools!

Thanks a lot, everything is appreciated!

story:
Icy is an RPG set in a post-apocalyptic world witnessing a new Ice Age. The player will create his/her own character and live an adventure across the White Wasteland, struggling each day to survive, without losing hope to find a better place where to thrive. Icy mixes role-play and survival dynamics, allowing the player to lead a nomad family in their fight for survival, and to take care of all the responsibilities a leader has, such as keeping the group together and planning how to face a hostile world.

Features:

  • Live a survival experience in a peculiar post-apocalyptic setting.
  • Create your character, characterizing it choosing among 3 main attributes and 10 different skills that affects the whole game.
  • Influence the plot with different choices, changing the course of events that will lead to multiple different endings.
  • Manage to keep together group of survivors, each one with different needs, values and ideals.
  • Scavenge for items and hunt for food, face the challenges of the Frozen World.
  • Enjoy more than 400 hand-drawn artworks.
  • More than 10'000 dialogue lines.
  • Day/night cycle that affects the gameplay.

Try Icy's alpha prototype!

We developed a 30-60 minutes alpha prototype, featuring the beginning of the game. Click here if you want to discover how Icy will change compared to this early build.

Windows: Mirror 1- Mirror 2

Stretch goals



Gameplay

Icy will be a narrative experience which will put the player in the role of a nomad family leader, traveling for survival in a hostile post-apocalyptic world. The player will be the one who will set the course, manage the supplies and, most of all, take the important decisions.


In terms of gameplay the player will manage most practical things on a 2D map with a complete interface that will allow he/she to travel around the world, hunt in the woods, scavenge old cities searching for something useful, manage the inventory and the party. All the actions that aren't really interesting from a narrative point of view will be managed through the map, but Icy is a narrative game and we created a proper system to let the player shape his/her own story in the game. 


The map will be similar to the ones we saw in games like Fallout or Arcanum and the player will be able to travel from an important location to another just by clicking on it. The map system will also simulate the different kind of terrain and the different levels of danger across the world: travelling through the woods will be slower than walking on an open road, but bandits can’t easily detect you and the wild beasts are usually easier to manage than a group of people armed with guns.


All events that are narratively interesting will be played using a game-book like system. We will use texts, 2D images, music and sounds to create a compelling storytelling that will allow the player to have a remarkable freedom of choice on both short and long terms. The player will have the full control on his/her character actions and words, allowing a deep roleplaying experience. Having these two different dimensions of gameplay allow us to create narrative content only for important events, without creating boring contents or random contents.


The character's stats will be really important in the game because the outcome of most choices is directly related to one or more skills. That doesn't mean that the player won't need to think to do the best choices, but that the plot will be affected by character's specializations and there will be a lot of different ways to solve a problem.

Setting

The post-apocalyptic setting of Icy is characterized by a never-ending winter. It will have a deep impact on all the themes we are exploring during the game. Most of the Earth is covered with ice and snow, and the land suitable for living is only a quarter of what it used to be.


What caused the world to turn into a White Wasteland? No one knows exactly what happened, though the legends are countless. Some say it was war, others say there was a cataclysm, and all stories differ. What is certain is the cloud of dust still in the atmosphere, and the forgotten color of the sky. Will the player have the chance to uncover the truth behind those legends?


The playable character will be part of a nomad family and will travel around the Frozen World, constantly worrying about finding food and shelter. Nomads' life is not easy: banditry is a common activity because there’s no law. The animals claimed back their land and a small human group is an easy prey for predators. The harsh climate is a constantly present threat in a survivor's life.

Why Indiegogo?

Why are we on Indiegogo? Icy is a self-funded project, but the little money we have is not enough to cover all the expenses we are facing. We could simply cut some content and release a simpler version of the game, but we want Icy to be as good as possible. That’s why we are here asking for your support. With a successful campaign we will be able to cover some legal expenses and spend more time refining and improving Icy. The result will be a better, more polished and definitely more enjoyable experience.


Perks


FAQ

Will Icy be DRM-free?

Yes, there will be DRM-free version of the game, at the same price.

On which platform will Icy be released?

On PC (Windows, Mac and Linux).

In which stage of development is the game?

We have finished working on the core features and we’re now polishing and improving it, in order to release a better game, with more contents and less bugs.

Why are you asking only for 2500$?

The game is in an advanced phase of the development, we just need some more money to be able to fully polish it. Being gamers we know how annoying could be to buy an incomplete or bugged game, that’s why we want Icy to be fully enjoyable since day one.

In which languages will Icy be available?

We wrote Icy in English and we have an editor that is already proofreading all the game contents. The game is getting translated in Italian too, but we don’t know if this translation will be available since day one.

I noticed that the English is not always so good, are you going to fix this?

Yes, we’re working with an experienced editor who is already proofreading all the in-game contents and we will soon integrate all the corrections in the game. Since we have a low budget, we focused our editor’s efforts on the game and not on the marketing stuff, that’s why you may sometimes notice a not so goo englis, but we can asure yu we will works on tis.

I don’t want to be racist, but you are an Italian team of developers and I don’t want my money to finance any criminal organization. How can we trust you?

If we had our hands in business like drugs dealing, prostitution or weapons smuggling, we could have asked for money from our godfather. Sadly we have no connections with the local organized crime, so we settled for an Indiegogo campaign.

I don’t like you and I don’t like your game. What should I do?

You should totally back it, taking the cheapest perk available, then wait until the release to criticize us on your socials and in your favorite communities, questioning the overall quality of our project.

story:
Trailer Video
            

Stretch Goals

Each chapter of Savior features different levels and distinct gameplay mechanics. As always, our goal is for the player to face unexpected situations throughout the game. Believe us: Savior is not a regular 2D platform.

Each goal funds an additional chapter of the game, and the objective is to create an interconnected world but at the same time one game that certainly we can develop, complete and deliver on time. 

    

Savior is 2D platformer full of crumbling ruins and bloody battles, civilizations on the brink of extinction, broken creatures and flawed heroes. For eons, this universe was kept in order by the Great God, but he has suddenly gone silent.

In his absence, the world begins to collapse, and as reality pulls apart, his followers wonder if they’re living in nothing more than a failing video game. You play as Little God, one of the few “saviors” able to communicate with the Great God, who may be able to restore order to his world.

As your set out to reach the Great God, you must learn to navigate the disintegrating universe and the troubled creatures that inhabit it. There are many other saviors like yourself, each increasingly desperate to save themselves from annihilation. Beware.

Savior isn’t just a game, it’s a reflection of our personal experiences in Cuba, from the crumbling scenery to the unpredictable story to the stylized and hand drawn artwork. It’s a product of our generation and the evolution of the Cuban artistic community. It gives the players the chance to peer into a unique world—in some ways familiar, but increasingly complex the deeper you go.

Our game is a product of this unique moment in Cuban history. The internet is just beginning to spread on the island. Relations with the US are improving. The economy is changing. The people are optimistic for the future, but uncertain what that future will look like.

Cuba is connecting to the rest of the world like never before. Though would have been impossible to create a game like Savior even just a few years ago, we now we have the opportunity to create a game like this in Cuba with a completely Cuban team. It's our chance to bring our unique voice to the global indie game scene.

Join us, and be a part of history.

This would be the one of the first crowdfunding campaign for a Cuban team. This is a monumental step for Cuban developers, and the best way that we feel we can raise money for this project.

Cuba is quite a challenging place to develop a game. Internet access is very limited, funding is hard to come by, equipment is out of date, it’s nearly impossible to participate in international festivals and events, and the developer community is just beginning to grow.

But we know that with your help, we can overcome all these obstacles, and create a truly unique experience, and Cuba’s first indie game!

Indiegogo has our heartfelt thanks for this tremendous opportunity. We owe to them, and to you, not only the existence of Savior, but the future of independent gaming in Cuba.

 

 
 
 
The world of Savior is one of fantastic locations, ghostly ruins and unreal scenery. It’s a melancholy, gloomy vision inspired by the symbolist artists of late nineteenth century. Every inch of Savior looks and feels unique.
 

The aesthetic of the game is inspired by two diverse art forms: comic books and stain glass windows. We pay homage to these sources in the stylization of our characters, using heavy contour lines and iconic imagery in our designs.

Iconic platformers like Earthworm Jim and Demon’s Crest strongly influence the aesthetics and gameplay of Savior, from the world design to the animation.

           

Savior relies on hand-drawn animation, sometimes using an exceptional 54 frames-per-second, which gives the game a human and lifelike feel.  Each creature’s unique movements and flow gives them their own personality.

Though the controls in Savior uses familiar platformer mechanics, as the game progresses, the world becomes increasingly erratic and surprising.

The levels continually confront players with situations both new and strange. Each world possesses its own unique characteristics, running through both the aesthetics and the gameplay.

The combat and interactions of Savior relies on a unique reaction-based gameplay that players must master.

1. To interact or attack, the player first initiates an expanding ring to select an object or attack a creature

2. Once the item or enemy is selected, the player’s halo will flash a particular color command

3. Players must quickly press the correct button to successfully execute their action or attack

4. Using the right sequence of commands and responses, players and trigger increasingly complex and destructive combos

The characters of Savior are as strange as they are diverse. Each world is unique and distinct, as are the creatures that inhabit it.

Little God: Upon discovering that the Great God has abandoned you, your only purpose is to regain his favor and restore his home.

Child: A strange figment that appears in the dreams of Little God. Is it just his imagination, perhaps a dark memory buried deep within him?

Nebro: This old savior lost his mind after being abandoned by the Great God.

Bleeders: Vicious and destructive creatures almost as old as the Great God himself.

Sacred beds: Ancient tombs that allow the saviors to communicate with the Great God through their dreams. There are few of them left, and so many saviors willing to do anything to find them…

Our Cuban-made score provides the perfect atmosphere. Ominous and eerie, the soundtrack only hints at what might befall the players as they explore the world of Savior.

After over a year of discussions, planning, designing, and assembling our team, we’ve worked tirelessly the past several months to bring our project this far. We’re operating in tandem, creating character designs and backgrounds, coding levels and gameplay mechanics, drawing animations, and composting the score.

With this first $10k we’ll be able to launch a playable demo of the game in February of 2017, encompassing the full opening chapter "The Boy Who Was Born to Die.” We will spend the next year gradually developing the game chapter-by-chapter. Our vision is for Savior to encompass multiple interconnected worlds with many paths and ways to play them.

Empty Head Games is composed of Josuhe Pagliery and Johann Armenteros. Early last year, the two of us entered a non-game called Destroyer in the 12th Havana Bienal, which was well-received and inspired us to pursue game development full-time. Though our work has always been inspired by video games, we’re excited to fully devote our efforts to indie game development.


We’ll be working with other key partners:


$5 Believer
Thanks for supporting Savior! For donating, you’ll get your name in the credits as a funder!

$8 Acolyte
Be the first is always cool! You’ll get a digital copy before anyone, plus your name in the credits. 

$10 Follower
Get the game! You’ll get a digital copy of Savior, plus your name in the credits. You’ll also be subscribed to our Savior newsletter.

$20 Pilgrim
Looking for a little more? As a Pilgrim, in addition to the game and your name in the credits, you get a copy of the Savior Digital Kit. The kit includes desktop backgrounds, digital artwork and the excellent and eerie Savior soundtrack by German Carrasco!

$30 Mystic
If you’re into gaming, this is the tier for you. You’ll get two additional mini-games: Destroyer and Savior 1.0, the first playable prototype of our game.

$40 Saint
Like the artwork in Savior? As a Saint, you’ll receive a limited edition print of artwork from the game, and you’ll get a digital booklet about the making of the game in addition to all the Mystic perks.

$50 Apostle
If you're looking to share your enthusiasm for the game, this one's for you. As an Martyr, in addition to all the Saint and Mystic perks, you’ll receive a special limited edition Savior t-shirt!

$70 Martyr (LIMITED 30)
Become a game tester! Not only will you get the game demo early next year, as well as all the other Apostle rewards, but you’ll be one of the select few able to test the game during the development. We’d love your feedback!

 

$100 Prophet (LIMITED 50)
Want something special? As a Prophet, you’ll receive all of the Martyr rewards plus a piece of original Savior artwork, signed by the artist himself. Supplies are limited!

 

$150 Savior (LIMITED 20)
All the Prophet rewards, plus one VIP ticket to the Savior demo party in March 2017. Empty Head Games will be taking over a gallery in Havana to host a release party for the Savior demo, featuring artwork from by the game as well as music, drinks, and a chance to play the demo live on the big screen! You’ll also get first dibs on which original artwork you’d like.

$200 Savior(s) (LIMITED 10)
Got a special someone? Get all the Savior perks, plus an extra ticket to the event!

$300 Little God (LIMITED 6)
See more than just your name in the credits. As a Little God, you’ll appear as a character of the Nebro’s Cult in Savior! Get ready to jump into a video game! Plus, you’ll get all of the Savior(s) rewards, including two tickets to the demo event.

$1000 Great God (LIMITED 4)
Looking for more than a night in Havana? As a Great God, you'll get to meet the creators and join them weekend in Cuba for a chance to see their game development process and gain an inside look at the country. You’ll get two full days of activities including lunches and dinners, you just need to get yourself to the island and find accommodations. Includes all the Little God perks.

              

Q: When the game will be finished?
A: We estimate 1 year of development after the demo launching, which means we anticipate we'll release the game in early 2018.

Q: Why is the campaign based in the United States?
A: Savior will be developed entirely in Cuba by a Cuban team, but due to restrictions with Indiegogo, the campaign is being run from the United States. Josuhe will be in the US for the duration of the campaign to ensure it runs without any problems, as internet access and phone calls are a challenge in Cuba.

Q: When I will get rewards?
A: Some rewards, such as the posters and t-shirts, will ship prior to the release of the game. Most rewards will be sent when the game is released. The demo event will take place in March of 2017.

Q: When will the demo event take place?
A: The exact date is not yet set, but it will be a Friday or Saturday in March.

Q: What platforms will Savior be available on?
A: For now, we are planning on releasing the game on Windows and Mac.

$300 Little God (LIMITED 6)See more than just your name in the credits. As a Little God, you’ll appear as a character of the Nebro’s Cult in Savior! Get ready to jump into a video game! Plus, you’ll get all of the Savior(s) rewards, including two tickets to the demo event.

$1000 Great God (LIMITED 4)Looking for more than a night in Havana? As a Great God, you'll get to meet the creators and join them weekend in Cuba for a chance to see their game development process and gain an inside look at the country. You’ll get two full days of activities including lunches and dinners, you just need to get yourself to the island and find accommodations. Includes all the Little God perks.
               
Q: When the game will be finished?A: We estimate 1 year of development after the demo launching, which means we anticipate we'll release the game in early 2018.
Q: Why is the campaign based in the United States?A: Savior will be developed entirely in Cuba by a Cuban team, but due to restrictions with Indiegogo, the campaign is being run from the United States. Josuhe will be in the US for the duration of the campaign to ensure it runs without any problems, as internet access and phone calls are a challenge in Cuba.
Q: When I will get rewards?A: Some rewards, such as the posters and t-shirts, will ship prior to the release of the game. Most rewards will be sent when the game is released. The demo event will take place in March of 2017.
Q: When will the demo event take place?A: The exact date is not yet set, but it will be a Friday or Saturday in March.
Q: What platforms will Savior be available on?A: For now, we are planning on releasing the game on Windows and Mac.

story:
The Backstory

First and foremost, I kind of came into this campaign believing that I could throw up some ideas and blindly hope for the best. But this is certainly the worst way to go about it. You all deserve a story.

I have been gaming since I was 2. I understand a lot of people make that claim, but I did have a Nintendo controller in my hand before I could thoroughly express my anger verbally when I got destroyed in Marble Madness. The backwards level will be my arch-nemesis forever. Let's continue...

My gaming life only continued to be fantastic. I proudly donned the digital blood of my enemies in Mortal Kombat, got horridly upset when I couldn't figure out the vine level of The Lion King (yes, I played that game-and it was awesome) and refused to play anything other than the Atlanta Hawks in NBA Jam.

At 14, I won second place at a Killer Instinct tournament. Fulgore is still my favorite.

My life, and my gaming, moved to computers accordingly. I built my first computer before the age of 18. Although I must admit, "gaming computers" didn't exactly exist then. It was more of a terminal to check my AOL Mail and chat in AOL Chatrooms, but I digress. I built my next computer in my early 20s and upgraded it obsessively for the next 5 years. With all my gained knowledge, I was able to sell my 6 year old build for more than the best computer builds at Best Buy.

In the end, I had to sell my computer simply because real life took precedence. My benchmarking had to be put on hold. Years passed and life crawled forward. I am now in my early 30s and tuition loans, rent, and life bills are still keeping me in the same place; albeit, I am no less happy.

This campaign is to let me be 20 again. Build my computer from the bare bones and pride myself in the final project.


Building my Computer

All the following components will be purchased for the build:

  • HDD
  • MOBO
  • SSD
  • RAM
  • GFX Card
  • Power Supply
  • Processor
  • Case Fans
  • Case

And the additional stuff:

  • Mouse
  • Keyboard
  • Monitors (2)

I appreciate all of your consideration. I understand there are a lot of fantastic, and worthy, fundraisers on here. I only hope you give me a moment of your time and donate even a small amount to my dream. Everything helps.

story:
Altered-what?

Altered History is the design line I created and launched in January 2012; inspired by my love of history and desire for travel and adventure in a world that never quite existed.  I have made a commitment to only have the Altered History line produced in America, and I work closely with the companies that manufacture my products to ensure the highest quality. 

Currently I am working on producing my Big Game Hunter design - aka, 'a lion wearing a monocle' - into a metal die-struck pin, in a nickel and in a bronze finish (and special limited edition red bronze, silver-plated, and gold-plated pins... more on those later).  The pin will measure about 1 inch wide, and about 1 1/8 inches high.

American Made 

These pins will be produced by ESCO, Inc – a family owned business based in Milwaukee, Wisconsin that has been producing emblematic jewelry since 1934.  They produced my last two pin designs, the Submariner and the Airship Wing, and do fantastic work.

So why fund my project? 

First of all, you will be giving a leg-up to an independent artist and small business (that’s me).  I am completely self-funded, so you’ll be helping me defray the cost of pin production, which will be an immense help.  

Second, you’ll be supporting the shop that is producing the pins right here in the USA, and supporting American workers.  That’s a win in my book! 

Crowdfunding sites like Indiegogo has allowed thousands of artists and designers like myself to bring their ideas into fruition and connect with a global audience.  It allows you to speak with your dollars. 

Simply put; if you like this concept, help me bring it to life!

What I need money for: 

Your contributions will go towards the manufacture of the first run of pins and packaging.  I've already paid for the image die, which is currently in production.

The die alone costs about $400 to produce, which I have already covered out of pocket, and the minimum amount of lion pins will run around $500.  The extra will go towards Indiegogo fees and perk shipping costs. 

What if I beat my goal? 

If I am over-funded, I will put that money toward more pins.  If we are on the road to being over-funded, I have some stretch goals in mind - we will cross that bridge when we get there!

Why Indiegogo? 

I used Indiegogo to fund my last two pin project, the Submariner Pin and the Airship Wing.  Indiegogo was easy to use, and had great tools that helped myself and my backers to help promote my project. 

How does Indiegogo work? 

Form now until March 30th you will be able to support this project through contributions ranging from $1 to whatever you can afford.  You can select one of the perks - listed to the right – of equal or lesser value to your contribution.  You can always pledge more than the minimum to get the perk you want. 

Since this project is 'Flex-Funded' you'll get your pins even if the project is short of goal; I will make up the difference out of my own pocket.

Perks

The Big Game Hunter Patch - $10 Contribution

Measures approx. 2 inches wide by 4 inches high.  Wool felt (70% wool, 30% rayon), 100% American Made, Sew On, Dry Clean Only

The Big Game Hunter Pin - $15 Contribution (Nickel or Brass finish)

$20 Contribution - Limited edition red bronze pin (only 25 produced)

$30 Contribution - Limited edition silver-plated pin (only 15 produced)

$50 Contribution - Limited edition gold-plated pin (only 5 produced)

Simple Logo Design - $125 Contribution

Do you have an idea for a logo, but don't know how to bring it to life?  Well, I can help you with that.  I will create a simple logo for you in black and white.  You will receive a digital copy of your new logo in several different file formats. 

Travel Painting on Reclaimed Wood Panel - $250 Contribution

While doing some remodeling work in my home last year, I reclaimed several wooden panels from old broken doors.  These panels measure roughly 20 inches long by 10.5 inches wide.  Name a city and I will work with you to create you a one-of-a-kind travel poster style painting on one of these wood panels with acrylic paint.  Which city will you choose?  Because these are each one-of-a-kind and hand painted, they will take me a little longer getting them to you, but I’m shooting for summer/fall 2014, and I will complete paintings in the order of contributor (so, if you’re the first contributor I will paint yours first).

***International contributors will have to pay actual shipping costs for this item***

Time Line

This campaign will run until March 30th.  It takes up to 14 days for your contributions to make their way to my bank account.  After that, production usually takes 30-45 days.  So, we can expect the Big Game Hunter pins to be done sometime in May 2014.  I will also keep you folks posted on progress as the pins are made.

Can't Contribute?  You Still Can Help

Do you have a family member, friend, or co-worker who would like this design?  Send them an e-mail about this campaign.

Share with your friends on Facebook.  Send out a tweet on Twitter.  Indiegogo makes it easy with their share tools.

Thank you for taking the time to look at my project!

story:
Our Story

This idea began as I sat and played a facebook game where I was very aware of what I had to do for the fake coins the game paid me.  I was more careful with them than with my bank account!  Being an artist as well as a computer chick I was also painfully aware of how few of my friends had any comfort in managing their money.  

 
All I could think was how cool it would be if I could simply play a game and have my money taken care of without having to look at graphs and decide on a budget. Shouldn't financial software see where my money goes and tell me I'm close to doom?  If I'm putting in all my receipts shouldn't I see a pretty picture of where it is going?  Maybe a nagging voice telling me not to keep spending on Eating Out cause at this rate eating at all will be difficult?  Why was I still doing all the work?  It's hard and boring and depressing to watch a bottom line fade to zero.   And somehow made me spend more to thumb my nose at stupid world that only rewarded me with a roof over my head for being frugal.
 
It's time to make money easy for the mathmatically challeged.  It's time to teach visual creatures how to spend wisely with intangible cartoon rewards backing up the true success of paying off debt and saving some cash.  With Lori Moucha as a designer and Lee Goffin-Bonenfant as our house nerd and programmer we're gonna Make Real LIfe More Fun!  


THE HOOK!

Of course, as we are at the beginning of a development cycle we've had a lot of ideas about game play, what is fun to do but Lori and I don't alway agree and need your help.  We are going to leave the final game name and game aesthetics UP TO YOU!  If you give us any money at all You GET A VOTE!  

The two finalists are Money Shot! A game where you sling shot money bags into a sky of obstacles and targets!  and in doing so you will be entering your receipts, tracking your bottom line and categorizing your spending so you can see how fat the different areas that take your cash are.

Or we can call it Bank On It! and set you up on a virtual pool table, with receipt balls on the table ready to be smacked into pockets of categories and bouncing off bumpers.


What We Need & What You Get

Ok so what we need is computer equipment, some software, and a way to pay the rent while we pull this game together.  The amount we're asking for as a start is simply to buy a couple of computers, developer rights, some software and an iphone or two for full testing.

Anything above our funding goal will go to pay our rents so we can focus on getting the game out to you. 


Besides a vote we have PERKS to thank you for supporting our dream.  Which you can see on the sidebar.  Plus, of course is a super cool game as a result.  There will be updates with test images, and as I keep thinking of things to give you random rewards thrown into the perks as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell everyone!  TELL EVERYONE THIS IS GOING TO SAVE THE ECONOMY AND THE WORLD!!!!

story:
There was a time in the history of Talgania where you could travel to any part of the world, but that time has passed with the great Cataclysm. Once the powers of the old was unleashed the world as we knew it was no more. Having the world broken apart into islands with magical barriers separating some from others changed everything. Many years later portals were discovered which allowed the people living on the planet to once more connect to each other, but with limited knowledge of these portals it is still not easy to travel around and sometimes you don’t end up where you had planned to go…

Islands Of War is a massively multiplayer online (MMO) game set in the time span 600 years after the great Cataclysm. The races have once more fueled their anger towards each other and have forgotten what happened in the first major war. You adventure into this war with your wits and your weapon. And you can bring as many friends as you want with you to join thousands of other players carving your name in the history books of Talgania.

What does IOW have to offer?
Unlike most MMORPGs, Islands Of War not only allows players to play the game at their own pace, but allows them to emerge themselves into the story line and the world. The quest system provides a wide variety of captivating quests with story elements with multiple endings giving that unique feel that the players choices makes a difference to where you will end up. If you combine this with a flexible reward system you have a quest system that will keep captivating your interest.

Islands Of War’s combat skill system is also unique allowing a player to choose there own type of character that suits best their combat style and tactics against multiple opponents. To top it off there is a builders club system allowing players to create their own adventures and game play type with the creation of their own islands. They can share these islands with their friends or if it follows the guidelines it can be incorporated right into the history books of Talgania.

What does IOW cost to play and how do I get started?
Islands of War is free to download and play. You will have a set of islands and areas you can play which will allow you to advance your character to the maximum character level of the game without paying anything. We will be selling items that will improve your gaming experience like a special backpack for more storage or extra character slots if you want to create more than two characters. Additional to this there will be many island packages you can choose from to buy if you wish and add to your free collection. These islands will offer other adventures other than the free ones but you don’t have to buy them all, you can choose which adventures and story line you want to follow. This also allows our builders club members that have built their own Islands which follow the guidelines to add their islands to the main world collection for others to buy, which in return can generate them some revenue, thus opening up the world of Talgania to players to leave their mark in the history books.

Funding
We have been in development for a few years and have till now funded the project by our self. For the project to move forward at a faster pace additional funding from you the players could help a lot. Here is a list of donation perks we will be giving to people.

  • $10 minimum: – entrance to closed beta testing.
  • $50 minimum: – entrance to closed beta testing, special in game cloak showing you are a platinum supporter.
  • $100 minimum: Entrance to closed beta testing,special in game cloak showing you are a golden supporter.First option to choose your house in game.

If you want to read more of the game visit us at our website www.islandsofwar.com

story:
Intro to Goatlings

Goatlings is a unique online virtual pet game. Get your own lovable sidekick by adopting a virtual Goatling! Then name them, raise them, play games, explore, and find treasure with your cute friend! Meet interesting residences, challenge baddys, and visit the beautiful Goat Princess. Discover unique foods, toys, and collectibles. Aide your Goatlings with equipment and healing items. Explore beautiful and mysterious landscapes filled with treasure and, in more distant places; danger! There are even unexplored locations just waiting to be discovered.

  • Free-To-play
  • Ad free
  • Friendly Community
  • Welcoming and adorable environment
  • Fun for all ages

Main Features


Adopt a Goatling - Go to the Adoption Center to get your very own Goatling! Visit the Appearance Doll shop and find a new look for your friend. Give the doll to your Goatling and the appearance will magically rub off on them! Appearance Dolls can be found many others ways too.


Customize your HA Buddy - HA Buddys are dress up human avatars. Mix and match hundreds of clothing items, clothing is not gender restricted, you may wear up to 20 items, and item layers are re-arrangeable to give you flexibility to customize your look. Show off your HA Buddy on your Profile and on the forums.

Play Games - Have lots of fun, get the highest scores, and win Sugar Stars! Sugar Stars are the in-game currency so stock up!


Set up a Shop - Vend your extra items in your shop to earn more Sugar Stars. Stash your Sugar Stars in the bank, and collect daily interest. You can also choose to list an auction or a trade.

Set up a Gallery - Start a collection and display your favorite items.

Browse the Shopping District - Many differentially themed shops, along with matching shopkeepers, can be found in the Shopping District. Pick up food, weapons, armor, healing items, toys, Appearance Dolls, and collectables. Crown Account members have special access to the VIP shop.


Go Exploring - Explore to capture wild Goatlings, fight Baddys, and find treasure. Many explore areas will be reveled over time when they are discovered.

Visit the Battle Center - The bravest of baddys visit the Battle Center for a limited time to challenge Goatlings. Sometimes for fun, but sometimes for mischief. Show them who is strongest, and get some awesome prizes for winning!


Get Creative - Members can show off their artistic spark by submitting their own Goatling designs which have a chance of being redrawn as official pets! All skill levels are welcome! Members can also submit their ideas and designs for HA Buddy Outfits and decorative banners for members to personalize their profiles, shops, and galleries.


Browse the Forums - Make your introduction, find friends, and contribute to conversations going on at the forums. If you need help, friendly members and staff will always be there to lend a hand and answer questions.

Join or Start a Club - Get together with friends and start or join a club. Make friends who share common interests, and chat on your clubs own mini forum.

And so much more!

About The Fundraiser

Goatlings started out as a very small game with around 100 wonderful members. After a great year, the population had grown to over 3,000 wonderful members! However, we realized the programing needed to be upgraded in order to keep everything running smoothly and securely for many years to come. But we did not have enough funding to get it all done at once on our own. After a couple of attempted hacking scares Goatlings has been temporarily closed until the programing is updated. With your help we will surly meet our goal in no time and get Goatlings.com back up again ASAP!

The entire site is being professionally recoded from the ground up. This will make the site more organized, easier to update, more secure, and function a lot smoother. User data will be reorganized and included so members will not lose anything. All features will be updated, missing or half finished features will be completed, and if we are fortunate enough to receive funding over our goal, never before seen features will be added like quests and crafting! The more the fundraiser gains, the more new content will be added!

People who donate will also receive neat perks such as account upgrades, adoption expansion, pet upgrades, unique avatar outfits, stickers, unique pet Goatlings, and much more!

Your donation will keep this beloved pet site running for years to come. Help Goatlings have a bright future!

How To Donate

You do not need to create an account on Goatlings or Indiegogo to donate. Just click on a perk/donation amount that you are interested in on the right side of this page. You can manually increase the rate but not decrease it. Payments can be made with a credit card or PayPal. An email is needed for communication, like in the case we need your display name on Goatlings for in-game item distribution. If you do not have a Goatlings account we will contact you again once the site is back open so you can create an account and let us know.

You can also help by sharing our fundraiser on Facebook, Tumblr, Twitter, forums, everywhere you can think of!


Contribution Perks

To thank you for your support, we have prepared some fun gifts! Email is required to confirm display name for in-game item distribution. Your contribution gifts will be waiting for you when the site is back up. A shipping address is required for the stickers. If you do not have a Goatlings account, we will contact you again once the site is back up so you can create an account and let us know. Here are previews of the cool loot you can get!

Unlockable Stretch Goals

For every funding milestone we reach we will release new and exiting content! Can you help us unlock them all?

$4,500 = + New Crafting feature

$5,000 = + New quests feature

$6,000 = + 10 new member designed Goatlings

$6,500 = + 50+ new items added to the Shopping District

$7,500 = + 6 new Daily freebie Gachapons

$8,000 = + New Shopping District Shop - Icecream Parlor

$8,500 = + New Shopping District Shop - Collectable Stickers

$9,000 = +  Profile Sticker Collection Feature

$9,500 = +  More Arcade Games

$10,000 = + Brand New Celebration Appearance Doll with new pose for all contributes!
story_txt:
Intro to Goatlings
Goatlings is a unique online virtual pet game. Get your own lovable sidekick by adopting a virtual Goatling! Then name them, raise them, play games, explore, and find treasure with your cute friend! Meet interesting residences, challenge baddys, and visit the beautiful Goat Princess. Discover unique foods, toys, and collectibles. Aide your Goatlings with equipment and healing items. Explore beautiful and mysterious landscapes filled with treasure and, in more distant places; danger! There are even unexplored locations just waiting to be discovered.

Free-To-play
Ad free

Friendly Community
Welcoming and adorable environment
Fun for all ages


Main Features
Adopt a Goatling - Go to the Adoption Center to get your very own Goatling! Visit the Appearance Doll shop and find a new look for your friend. Give the doll to your Goatling and the appearance will magically rub off on them! Appearance Dolls can be found many others ways too.Customize your HA Buddy - HA Buddys are dress up human avatars. Mix and match hundreds of clothing items, clothing is not gender restricted, you may wear up to 20 items, and item layers are re-arrangeable to give you flexibility to customize your look. Show off your HA Buddy on your Profile and on the forums.Play Games - Have lots of fun, get the highest scores, and win Sugar Stars! Sugar Stars are the in-game currency so stock up!Set up a Shop - Vend your extra items in your shop to earn more Sugar Stars. Stash your Sugar Stars in the bank, and collect daily interest. You can also choose to list an auction or a trade. Set up a Gallery - Start a collection and display your favorite items. Browse the Shopping District - Many differentially themed shops, along with matching shopkeepers, can be found in the Shopping District. Pick up food, weapons, armor, healing items, toys, Appearance Dolls, and collectables. Crown Account members have special access to the VIP shop.Go Exploring - Explore to capture wild Goatlings, fight Baddys, and find treasure. Many explore areas will be reveled over time when they are discovered. Visit the Battle Center - The bravest of baddys visit the Battle Center for a limited time to challenge Goatlings. Sometimes for fun, but sometimes for mischief. Show them who is strongest, and get some awesome prizes for winning!Get Creative - Members can show off their artistic spark by submitting their own Goatling designs which have a chance of being redrawn as official pets! All skill levels are welcome! Members can also submit their ideas and designs for HA Buddy Outfits and decorative banners for members to personalize their profiles, shops, and galleries. Browse the Forums - Make your introduction, find friends, and contribute to conversations going on at the forums. If you need help, friendly members and staff will always be there to lend a hand and answer questions.Join or Start a Club - Get together with friends and start or join a club. Make friends who share common interests, and chat on your clubs own mini forum. And so much more!

The more the fundraiser gains, the more new content will be added!
People who donate will also receive neat perks such as account upgrades, adoption expansion, pet upgrades, unique avatar outfits, stickers, unique pet Goatlings, and much more! Your donation will keep this beloved pet site running for years to come. Help Goatlings have a bright future!

story:
About Zeni

Zeni is probably one of the most amazing people I have had the pleasure of meeting. She has shown countless times that she is dedicated to this site just as much as I am. For months she has been working without pay, dealing with bugs, adding new features, and occassionally getting harrassed by players. Without her, Paka Sanura could never have happened.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to pay Zeni. At the time that I am typing this, the overdue payments add up to $400USD. And yet Zeni has continued working hard for us. When the campaign ends, if we reach our goal, we will have caught up. And that matters to me a lot.
For the next 60 days, this is how members will purchase upgrades.

Why This Is So Important

As the owner of the site, I can calmly and honestly say that I want Zeni to get paid. Without Zeni, we would never function as a site. We need her. And she needs to get paid. Just think, the sooner she gets paid the more likely it is the genetics bugs and crons will get fixed!

Other Ways You Can Help

Advertise, advertise, advertise. get the word out there. Please.

story:
IMPORTANT UPDATE:

If you live outside Europe, take a look at the perks to order several copies, where the shipping costs are greatly reduced!

Our Story

Did you like our trailer for Wilderness – a game of survival? This is a great board-game that we have worked on for decades that is now ready for release!!

Who are we? We are four brothers that are passionate about games, both playing them and making them. We started our family business FryxGames last year to make games like this available to you and to anyone who share our passion for board-games…

Wilderness is our very first game, a game where you and up to 8 players struggle to find food and water and to survive to the village that waits on the other end of the wilderness. It’s a game of tactics where everything weighs in; your condition, the weather, when night will come, how the animals move, the terrain and what options you might have on your Event Cards. And there's always a dangerous balance between rushing to win or get along safe and slow. Find your own way to survive the wilderness…

You can be the first to get this game – and at a good price! Make your donation here and the game will be sent home to you directly from the factory. At the same time you are greatly helping our small family business to afford printing this game in a larger edition. We need your help to survive in the game industry wilderness!

The Impact

This game has already created a lot of attention in its handmade edition. At Essen Spiel’11 it ranked second place on BoardGameGeeks voting list!!!

http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geekbuzz/overview/...

We hope to enrich thousands of gamers with this unique, intriguing and beautiful game. By supporting us you are not only getting a good game for yourself, but you are also helping us to reach out with this game to others who might enjoy it

What We Need & What You Get

We take a big risk when we produce this game. We have no sponsors or fortunes so we need to take a big loan to mass-print this game in a real game factory. We hope we can sell enough to pay it back. We need you to make this work.

You get a brand new, beautiful, exciting game sent home to your address anywhere in the world! A game you can play from 2-8 players, that will be enjoyed by the whole family (age 10+) or game group and the length can be adjusted to your needs. Choose to play with 4 landscape tiles for a shorter (about 1 hour) game, choose 6 landscapes for the normal and choose 8 landscapes (about 2 hours or more) for your late-night-gaming…

Read and see a lot more on our website:

http://www.fryxgames.se/?page_id=17

And don’t miss this video-review from Essen:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=endscreen&...

Other Ways You Can Help

Do you know someone else who might like Wilderness? Spread the word! Sharing this campaign on facebook, twitter or any other community may lead to a greater donation than we could possibly hope for. We cannot thank you enough for helping us reach others…

 

 

IMPORTANT NOTE: The Wilderness you see on the trailer or on other material is the handmade edition. The printed version will look slightly different. For example, landscape tiles and cards will probably be better quality. Most importantly, it will have simple wooden figures instead of metal figures. Hand-painted, metal figures are sold and sent home separately to those who would like them.

 

UPDATE: Our perk info for World-Wide Wilderness (95$) is in error. The shipping fee is 49$. The perk info cannot be updated, since it has already been claimed. We apologize for this error. The sum of 95$ is correct.

story:
Gladiators

You are a young man, dreaming of fame and glory in the Arena. You are a former soldier, hunting easy pickings amongst inexperienced rivals. You are a slave, fighting to earn your freedom. Whatever your origin, you are a Gladiator of the Roman Empire, and the Gods have one of two fates in store for you: Glory or Death.

 

Gladiators is an exciting new board game set on the blood-stained sands of the ancient Roman arena. Pick one of 12 unique Gladiators; fight arena threats and other players as you hack, slash and bleed your way into the hearts of your fans. Gladiators is a mix of visceral combat and cunning tactics. You cautiously negotiate the Arena’s deadly traps and dangerous beasts as you seek the best spot to strike at your opponents. In Gladiators, every game is different, a new opportunity to be the greatest fighter of all time.

Who are we?

Gladiators is conceived and developed by us: Geoff Rollins and Patrice Combatalade. Check out the video if you want to see our fine Roman features. We are two game designers, with long experience in the video game industry. One day we said to ourselves: “I bet we could make a great board game on our own. No programmers! No limitations! No free coffee…” Almost a year later, we have a coffee maker and Gladiators, a game that oozes blood, swords and sandals.


Why we need your help

We turn to you, the gaming public, in our hour of need. We have hired a specialist company to help do the art, box design, figurines and initial publication needed to take Gladiators to prime-time. We need $9,000 to pay for this, and for the promotional material they’re also helping us create. We want Gladiators to be the first in a long line of great games, and we need your help to make this happen! Give that which is Caesar’s unto us instead. For Rome! For Glory! For a great new game!

What do I get out of this?

Aside from a warm fuzzy feeling, you’ll get great rewards for throwing some cash our way. For $20, you get special thanks in our Instructions booklet and/or on our website (depending on how many people we have to thank). For $50, you get thanks and ‘Caligula’, a special promo character available only to our project’s supporters. For $100, you get thanks, Caligula, and a copy of our game, once it comes out. Just a warning: we fully expect our game to retail for $60. We’re asking $100 for the pre-order to help get us over that $9,000 money-hump.

 

At $250, you get all the other rewards, plus you’re entered into a draw to have a promotional character made with YOUR face, and skills of your choice. You and other donors at this level will receive 5 copies of this character, to keep or pass around as you wish. Finally, we have our ridiculously generous donation level of $500, where we GUARANTEE you a promo character with your face and the skills of your choice. We’ll send you the draw winner’s character and all the other rewards as well.

 

Note: Characters other than Caligula will be provided in the form of character cards, and a recommendation on which figurine to use to represent him or her. At a later date, we plan on creating 3D models of all our characters, which can be turned into figurines using 3D printers.

Caveat Emperor


Meet Caligula, our promo character and one of the most infamous of Rome’s Emperors. He created an official cult which worshipped him as a god. He slaughtered hundreds of Romans who refused to worship him as he thought he deserved. He was said to mix the blood of slaughtered ‘heretics’ with his evening wine. He fought matches in the Arena, quasi-executions where he was rarely in danger.

 

Our game twists history a bit: Caligula can definitely lose, but his bloody tendencies are fully in place: He fights as a Scissores, a type of Gladiator who can literally carve opponents to pieces. Caligula has a unique skill, ‘Worship Me’, where he forces the crowd to cheer him on (or else).

 

All donors at the $50 level and above will receive a copy of the Caligula character card and figurine, sent to the address of your choice (North America only).

Our Future Plans

We will be posting updates to this campaign at least once a week, where we will look at some or our playable gladiators, cards, and game-play elements in-depth. We will also be show-casing the art we receive as it comes in. You will be kept up to date on conventions we’re going to or live demos we’re planning as the game comes closer to completion. If you’re in or near the Montreal area, our first live demos will be there.

 

Once this campaign is over, we’ll still have to actually publish and distribute the game (which we’re doing ourselves). We are searching for publishing and distribution partners as we speak, but having cash in hand will let us negotiate the best deal, rather than having to take the first offer that comes our way. Any money we receive above and beyond our target $9,000 will help us achieve this goal.

Break out the Salt-Shaker

Roman Legionnaires were often paid in salt; thus the word ‘salary’. Artists and printers, however, are paid in money. Please give generously to make Gladiators a reality.

 

Legal Note:

We are using clips and music from Star Trek under the terms of Fair Use. We are not selling Star Trek products or related materials. Star Trek is owned and copyright by CBS.
